You said:
run a nectjs project for the first time in arch
ChatGPT said:

To run a Next.js project for the first time on Arch Linux, follow these steps:

1. Install Node.js and npm

Ensure you have Node.js and npm installed. If not, install them using the following:

bash
sudo pacman -S nodejs npm

You can verify the installation with:

bash
node -v
npm -v

2. Create a New Next.js Project

You can create a new Next.js project using create-next-app:

bash
npx create-next-app@latest my-next-app
cd my-next-app

Alternatively, if you cloned an existing project:

bash
git clone <repository_url>
cd <project_directory>

3. Install Dependencies

Inside the project directory, install the required dependencies:

bash
npm install

If you're using Yarn:

bash
yarn install

4. Run the Development Server

Start the development server using:

bash
npm run dev

or with Yarn:

bash
yarn dev

By default, it will be available at: http://localhost:3000

5. Open the Project in Your Browser

Visit http://localhost:3000 to see your Next.js app in action.

6. Optional: Install PM2 for Production (if needed)

If you want to run it in production mode, consider using PM2:

bash
sudo npm install -g pm2
npm run build
pm2 start npm --name "nextjs-app" -- start

If you face any issues or need further customization, let me know!

You said:
./app/components/benefits.tsx:3:0 Module not found: Can't resolve 'slick-carousel/slick/slick.css' 1 | import React from "react"; 2 | import Slider from "react-slick"; > 3 | import "slick-carousel/slick/slick.css"; 4 | import "slick-carousel/slick/slick-theme.css"; 5 | import { useMediaQuery } from "react-responsive"; 6 | https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/module-not-found Import trace for requested
ChatGPT said:

This error occurs because the slick-carousel package is not installed in your project. To fix it, follow these steps:

1. Install slick-carousel and react-slick

These are required for using the carousel in React:

bash
npm install slick-carousel react-slick

Or if you're using Yarn:

bash
yarn add slick-carousel react-slick

2. Verify Installation

Check if the packages are listed in your package.json:

json
"dependencies": {
  "react-slick": "^your_version",
  "slick-carousel": "^your_version"
}

3. Restart Development Server

Sometimes the Next.js server needs a restart to recognize new modules:

bash
npm run dev

or

bash
yarn dev

4. Clear Cache (if necessary)

If the issue persists, clear npm/Yarn cache:

bash
npm cache clean --force

or

bash
yarn cache clean

Then reinstall dependencies:

bash
rm -rf node_modules
npm install

Or with Yarn:

bash
rm -rf node_modules
yarn install

5. Alternative: Importing CSS Globally (Next.js)

If you encounter issues with CSS imports, import them in styles/globals.css or in _app.tsx:

js
import "slick-carousel/slick/slick.css";
import "slick-carousel/slick/slick-theme.css";

This is recommended because Next.js might not support CSS imports in component files depending on the configuration.

After these steps, the error should be resolved. If you still encounter issues, let me know!

You said:
./app/components/benefits.tsx:5:0 Module not found: Can't resolve 'react-responsive' 3 | import "slick-carousel/slick/slick.css"; 4 | import "slick-carousel/slick/slick-theme.css"; > 5 | import { useMediaQuery } from "react-responsive"; 6 | 7 | const BenefitsSection = () => { 8 | const isSmallScreen = useMediaQuery({ query: "(max-width: 1199px)" }); https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/module-not-found Import trace for requested module: ./app/page.tsx
ChatGPT said:

The error you're seeing indicates that the react-responsive module is not installed in your project. To fix this, follow these steps:

1. Install react-responsive

You can install the missing package using npm or Yarn.

With npm:

bash
npm install react-responsive

With Yarn:

bash
yarn add react-responsive

2. Verify Installation

Check that react-responsive appears in your package.json dependencies:

json
"dependencies": {
  "react-responsive": "^your_version"
}

3. Restart Development Server

After installing the package, restart the Next.js development server to ensure it picks up the new package:

bash
npm run dev

or

bash
yarn dev

4. Optional: Clear Cache (if necessary)

If the issue persists, you might want to clear the cache and reinstall the dependencies:

bash
npm cache clean --force
rm -rf node_modules
npm install

Or for Yarn:

bash
yarn cache clean
rm -rf node_modules
yarn install

After these steps, the error should be resolved. Let me know if you encounter any more issues!

You said:
make this a footer const HeroSection = () => { return ( <section className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0" style={{ position: "relative", backgroundColor: "#081420", minHeight: "60vh", }} > <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743"> <svg data-name="Layer 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 1200 120" preserveAspectRatio="none" > <path d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z" className="shape-fill" ></path> </svg> </div> <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5"> <div className="row align-items-center py-5"> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0"> <div className="hero-text pb-5"> <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3"> JUKTI{" "} <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline"> <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club of CSE </span> </h1> <p className="lead"> <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of Department of Computer Science and Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh </p> <a href="#" className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0" > Register now! </a> </div> </div> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4"> <div className="hero-image text-center d-none d-lg-block"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Hero Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "30%" }} /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default HeroSection;
ChatGPT said:

To convert the HeroSection into a footer, you'll need to adjust its content and positioning. Here’s how you can modify your code to turn it into a footer:

Changes:

  • Adjust the section to be at the bottom.

  • Make sure it's responsive and the height is appropriate for a footer.

  • Change content to suit a footer (e.g., contact information, social media links, etc.).

  • You can keep the shape divider, but reverse it or make it more subtle.

Here’s how the updated code might look:

tsx
const FooterSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "20vh", // Adjusted for footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-top-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 0L0 103.52 0 120 1200 120 1200 0z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0">
            <div className="footer-text pb-5">
              <h4 className="display-4 fw-bold mb-3">Contact Us</h4>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is always open to
                new ideas and collaborations. Feel free to reach out.
              </p>
              <a
                href="mailto:contact@jukti.com"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Email Us!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="footer-image text-center d-none d-lg-block">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "20%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};
export default FooterSection;

Key Changes:

  1. Section Name: Changed from HeroSection to FooterSection.

  2. Height Adjustment: Set minHeight to 20vh for a smaller height suitable for a footer.

  3. Shape Divider: The shape divider now curves upwards to give the footer a nice look.

  4. Text Content: Changed the heading to "Contact Us" and the text to be more footer-related.

  5. Image Size: Reduced the image size and positioned it for footer use.

Optional:

  • You can add social media icons, a sitemap, or copyright information to the footer as needed.

Let me know if you'd like to add any other elements to the footer!

const FooterSection = () => {
  return (
    <
You said:
add this The official club of the Department of CSE Email: jukti.iub@gmail.com add socials
ChatGPT said:

Here’s the updated code with the added text "The official club of the Department of CSE," the email address jukti.iub@gmail.com, and social media links (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Instagram):

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const FooterSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "25vh", // Adjusted for footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-top-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 0L0 103.52 0 120 1200 120 1200 0z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0">
            <div className="footer-text pb-5">
              <h4 className="display-4 fw-bold mb-3">The Official Club of the Department of CSE</h4>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p>Email: <a href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com" className="text-white">jukti.iub@gmail.com</a></p>
              <div className="social-icons">
                <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a href="https://www.twitter.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="text-white" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="footer-image text-center d-none d-lg-block">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "20%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default FooterSection;

Key Additions:

  1. Club Description: Added "The official club of the Department of CSE" as the heading.

  2. Email Address: Added Email: jukti.iub@gmail.com with a clickable mailto link.

  3. Social Media Links:

    • Added icons for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn using the react-icons package.

    • You can replace the URLs with actual links to your social media accounts.

Installation of react-icons:

If you don’t have react-icons installed, you can add it with:

bash
npm install react-icons

or with Yarn:

bash
yarn add react-icons

Let me know if you'd like to make further adjustments!

makr the text small make the email bigger make everything look professional import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa'; const Footer = () => { return ( <section className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0" style={{ position: "relative", backgroundColor: "#081420", minHeight: "25vh", // Adjusted for footer height }} > <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5"> <div className="row align-items-center py-5"> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0"> <div className="footer-text pb-5"> <h4 className="display-4 fw-bold mb-3">The Official Club of the Department of CSE</h4> <p className="lead"> <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh. </p> <p>Email: <a href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com" className="text-white">jukti.iub@gmail.com</a></p> <div className="social-icons"> <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaFacebook size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.twitter.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaTwitter size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaInstagram size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="text-white" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaLinkedin size={30} /> </a> </div> </div> </div> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4"> <div className="footer-image text-center d-none d-lg-block"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Footer Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "20%" }} /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default Footer;
ChatGPT said:

To make the footer look more professional, we can:

  1. Make the text smaller by adjusting the font sizes.

  2. Make the email stand out by increasing its font size.

  3. Enhance the layout with padding/margins and some cleaner design tweaks.

Here's the updated code with those changes:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "25vh", // Adjusted for footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Left Column */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0">
            <div className="footer-text pb-5">
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}>
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="footer-image text-center d-none d-lg-block">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "20%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Changes:

  1. Text Size:

    • The heading "The Official Club of the Department of CSE" is slightly reduced to 1.5rem for a cleaner look.

    • The general paragraph text is reduced to 1rem, which looks professional and neat.

  2. Email:

    • Increased the email link's font size to 1.5rem and made it bold to make it stand out.

  3. Social Icons:

    • Increased the size of social media icons to 1.5rem for consistency and to make them visually prominent.

  4. Spacing:

    • Added some spacing around the email and social icons for a more balanced layout.

Optional Further Enhancements:

  • Hover Effects: Add hover effects to the email and social icons to make them more interactive.

  • Footer Bottom Line: Consider adding a subtle bottom border or background gradient for visual separation from the rest of the page.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments or additions!

ChatGPT said:

To remove the countdown and add an orange button, here's the updated version of the EventsCTA component:

tsx
import React from "react";

const EventsCTA = () => {
  return (
    <section className="bg-white container position-relative elevate">
      <div>
        <div className="row align-items-center">
          <div className="col-md-6 p-2 text-center">
            <h2 className="display-6 fw-bold text-center">
              Join us on <span className="text-orange">Next Sunday</span>
            </h2>
            <p className="lead px-5 mt-3">
              Stay tuned for exciting
              <span>
                <a
                  href="/eventPage"
                  className="text-orange fw-bold"
                  style={{ textDecoration: "none" }}
                >
                  upcoming events
                </a>
              </span>
              and activities that will keep you engaged and inspired!
            </p>
            <a
              href="/eventPage"
              className="btn btn-lg btn-orange text-white mt-4"
              style={{ backgroundColor: "#ff5722", borderColor: "#ff5722" }}
            >
              Learn More
            </a>
          </div>
          <div className="col-md-6 p-5">
            <div className="text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Event Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "80%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default EventsCTA;

Key Changes:

  1. Removed Countdown: The countdown section (col-3 count-text) is removed.

  2. Orange Button:

    • Added a button with the class btn-orange and customized it with a background color of #ff5722 (orange).

    • Styled the button to make it stand out and added a link to the event page (/eventPage).

  3. Centered Image: The image is kept but will scale within the container to avoid overflow.

CSS for btn-orange (if you need it in your stylesheet):

css
.btn-orange {
  background-color: #ff5722;
  border-color: #ff5722;
}

.btn-orange:hover {
  background-color: #e64a19;
  border-color: #e64a19;
}

Let me know if you'd like to make more adjustments!

You said:

ChatGPT said:

To add padding and ensure the button is properly aligned, you can adjust the padding of the columns and center the button within the second column. Here's the updated version of the EventsCTA component with these changes:

tsx
import React from "react";

const EventsCTA = () => {
  return (
    <section className="bg-white container position-relative elevate py-5">
      <div>
        <div className="row align-items-center">
          {/* Left Column */}
          <div className="col-md-6 text-center p-5">
            <h2 className="display-6 fw-bold">
              Join us on our <span className="text-orange">Next Event</span>
            </h2>
            <p className="lead px-5 mt-3">
              Stay tuned for exciting
              <span>
                <a
                  href="/eventPage"
                  className="text-orange fw-bold"
                  style={{ textDecoration: "none" }}
                >
                  upcoming events
                </a>
              </span>
              and activities that will keep you engaged and inspired!
            </p>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Button Section) */}
          <div className="col-md-6 text-center p-5">
            <a
              href="/eventPage"
              className="btn btn-lg btn-orange text-white mt-4"
              style={{
                backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
                borderColor: "#ff5722",
                padding: "10px 20px", // Added padding for the button
                fontSize: "1.2rem", // Increased font size for better readability
              }}
            >
              Learn More
            </a>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default EventsCTA;

Key Changes:

  1. Padding:

    • Added py-5 (padding on the top and bottom) to the section for more spacing around the content.

    • The text sections (left and right columns) are given p-5 (padding on all sides) to give them more space inside.

  2. Button Alignment:

    • The button is now inside the right column (col-md-6), and it is centered properly using the text-center class.

    • Added padding: "10px 20px" to the button for more comfortable click/tap size.

    • Increased the font size to 1.2rem for better readability.

  3. Padding and Margins:

    • Used mt-4 (margin-top) to give the button a bit of space from the content above it.

This should make everything look more aligned and professional, with proper spacing. Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

You said:
image not showing in mobile const HeroSection = () => { return ( <section className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0" style={{ position: "relative", backgroundColor: "#081420", minHeight: "60vh", }} > <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743"> <svg data-name="Layer 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 1200 120" preserveAspectRatio="none" > <path d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z" className="shape-fill" ></path> </svg> </div> <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5"> <div className="row align-items-center py-5"> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0"> <div className="hero-text pb-5"> <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3"> JUKTI{" "} <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline"> <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club of CSE </span> </h1> <p className="lead"> <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of Department of Computer Science and Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh </p> <a href="#" className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0" > Register now! </a> </div> </div> <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4"> <div className="hero-image text-center d-none d-lg-block"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Hero Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "30%" }} /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default HeroSection;
ChatGPT said:

It seems like the image is only visible on larger screens due to the d-none d-lg-block class, which hides the image on mobile devices. To make sure the image is visible on mobile, you can use responsive Bootstrap classes to show it on smaller screens as well.

Here’s the updated version where I’ve modified the image container to be visible on mobile:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="hero-image text-center">
              {/* Changed d-none d-lg-block to d-block for mobile responsiveness */}
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};
export default HeroSection;

Key Changes:

  • Responsive Image Visibility: Removed the d-none d-lg-block class and replaced it with just d-block. This ensures that the image is visible on all screen sizes, including mobile.

  • Optional Adjustment: If you only want the image to be smaller on mobile, you can use the img-fluid class (which you already have) and add some custom styles to control the image size on different screen sizes (e.g., using style={{ width: "50%" }} for smaller screens).

Now, the image should be visible on both desktop and mobile devices. Let me know if you'd like further tweaks!

You said:
make the logo on top
ChatGPT said:

To move the logo to the top of the section while keeping the text and button below it, you can adjust the layout so that the image appears first in the column. Here's how you can do that:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 text-center">
            {/* Move the image to the top */}
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ width: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
          {/* Text and Button Column */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4"></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Changes:

  1. Moved Image to the Top: The logo image is now inside the first column (col-lg-6), placed before the text section. This makes the logo appear first at the top.

  2. Removed Empty Column: The second column (col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4) is now empty, as the image is already in the first column.

Now, the logo will be at the top of the section, followed by the title, text, and the "Register now" button. Let me know if this works for you or if you'd like any further changes!

ChatGPT said:

To ensure that the layout remains responsive and does not break on desktop, we need to properly structure the layout. I’ll update the design to make the logo appear first, but it will still remain correctly aligned for desktop and mobile views.

Updated Code:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center">
            {/* Logo section */}
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4">
            {/* Text section */}
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Adjustments:

  1. Responsive Column Layout:

    • Used col-lg-6 col-12 for both columns. This ensures that the image and text are side by side on large screens, but will stack vertically on smaller screens.

    • col-lg-6 for desktop (image and text take up half the width each).

    • col-12 for smaller screens (image and text each take full width).

  2. Image Max Width:

    • Used maxWidth: "30%" for the logo image to make it more responsive.

  3. Mobile and Desktop Layout:

    • The logo will appear on top of the text on smaller screens.

    • On larger screens, the logo will be aligned to the left and the text will appear on the right.

This should now keep everything properly aligned and responsive on both desktop and mobile views. Let me know how this works!

You said:
reverse the logo on dekstop
ChatGPT said:

To reverse the order of the logo and the text on desktop, you can swap the content in the columns for the desktop view while keeping the same stacking behavior on mobile.

Here’s how you can adjust the layout:

Updated Code:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Text section on the left for desktop, and on top for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
          {/* Logo section on the right for desktop, and below the text for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center">
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Changes:

  1. Reverse Content for Desktop:

    • On large screens (col-lg-6), the text column comes first, followed by the logo column. On mobile (col-12), they will stack vertically as before.

  2. Order of Columns:

    • The logo column (col-lg-6 col-12 text-center) is now after the text column on desktop.

    • The text column (col-lg-6 col-12 ps-4) is before the logo column on desktop, and the layout on smaller screens remains unchanged.

This layout now displays the logo below the text on mobile and moves the logo to the right of the text on desktop. Let me know how this works for you!

You said:
keep desktop same but reverse column in mobile
ChatGPT said:

To reverse the columns only on mobile (while keeping the desktop layout the same), we can use Bootstrap's responsive utility classes. Specifically, we can apply the order-last class on the logo column to move it below the text column on mobile screens while maintaining the default order on larger screens.

Updated Code:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Text section on the left for desktop, and on top for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Logo section on the right for desktop, and below the text for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center order-lg-first order-last">
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Adjustments:

  1. Bootstrap Classes:

    • order-lg-first: Ensures the logo appears first on larger screens (desktop and above).

    • order-last: Ensures the logo appears last (below the text) on smaller screens (mobile).

  2. Mobile Reversal:

    • On smaller screens (col-12), the logo will appear below the text due to the order-last class. On larger screens (col-lg-6), the default order will be maintained with the text first and the logo second.

Result:

  • On desktop, the layout will stay as it was originally (text on the left, logo on the right).

  • On mobile, the order will reverse, so the logo will appear below the text.

Let me know how this works!

  1. Use the order-lg-last class for the logo so that it stays on the right on desktop.

  2. Ensure the text comes first on both desktop and mobile.

  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{

        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}

      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">

          data-name="Layer 1"

            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Text section on the left for desktop, and on top for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>

              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Logo section on the right for desktop, and below the text for mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center order-lg-last">
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Adjustments:

  1. order-lg-last on Logo: This ensures the logo appears last (right side) on large screens (desktop).

  2. Mobile Reversal: The logo appears below the text due to the change in the order only on mobile and small screens.

Result:

  • Desktop: The text will remain on the left and the logo on the right.

  • Mobile: The logo will be placed below the text.

This should now be aligned with what you intended. Let me know if this works for you!

You said:
logo right on desktop and above text in mobile
ChatGPT said:

Got it! Let's fix this so that:

  • On desktop, the logo is on the right.

  • On mobile, the logo is above the text.

To do this, we will use the order class to control the placement of elements based on screen size.

Updated Code:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Text section: stays first on all screens */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Logo section: right on desktop, above text on mobile */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center order-1 order-lg-2">
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Key Changes:

  1. order-1 order-lg-2 on the Logo:

    • On mobile (col-12), the logo will appear above the text because of order-1.

    • On desktop (col-lg-6), it will appear on the right because of order-lg-2.

  2. Text Section: Remains first on all screen sizes, no need to change the order for the text.

Result:

  • Desktop: The text is on the left and the logo is on the right.

  • Mobile: The logo appears above the text.

Let me know if that works!

You said:
not behaving properly
ChatGPT said:

Apologies for the confusion earlier! Let's get it fixed.

For this, we need the following behavior:

  • On desktop, the text is on the left and the logo is on the right.

  • On mobile, the logo should appear above the text.

We will use the order property to achieve this. Here is the corrected version:

Updated Code:

tsx
const HeroSection = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="hero text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "60vh",
      }}
    >
      <div className="custom-shape-divider-bottom-1686588743">
        <svg
          data-name="Layer 1"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
          preserveAspectRatio="none"
        >
          <path
            d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
            className="shape-fill"
          ></path>
        </svg>
      </div>
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Text section */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 ps-4 order-2 order-lg-1">
            <div className="hero-text pb-5">
              <h1 className="display-3 fw-bold mb-3">
                JUKTI{" "}
                <span className="display-6 d-block d-md-inline">
                  <span className="d-none d-md-inline">-</span>The Official Club
                  of CSE
                </span>
              </h1>
              <p className="lead">
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the
                Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and
                Engineering of Independent University, Bangladesh
              </p>
              <a
                href="#"
                className="btn btn-dark-navy btn-lg btn-outline-orange me-4 mt-1 mt-sm-0"
              >
                Register now!
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Logo section */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-12 p-0 text-center order-1 order-lg-2">
            <div className="hero-image mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Hero Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ maxWidth: "30%" }}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default HeroSection;

Explanation:

  1. order-2 order-lg-1 on Text:

    • On mobile, the text is placed second (order-2).

    • On desktop, the text remains first (order-lg-1).

  2. order-1 order-lg-2 on Logo:

    • On mobile, the logo is placed first (order-1), making it appear above the text.

    • On desktop, the logo is placed second (order-lg-2), ensuring it stays to the right of the text.

Result:

  • Desktop: The text will be on the left, and the logo will be on the right.

  • Mobile: The logo will be above the text.

Let me know if this works!

You said:

target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaInstagram size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="text-white" target="_blank" rel="noopener text-center d-none d-lg-block"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Footer Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "20%" }} /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default ChatGPT said:

It seems the logo is not showing on mobile because the class d-none d-lg-block is hiding the image on smaller screens. This class makes the logo visible only on large screens (LG and above).

To fix this and make the logo visible on mobile, we need to adjust the visibility classes. You can replace d-none d-lg-block with responsive classes like d-block d-lg-none to make the logo visible on mobile and hidden on larger screens.

Here's the updated code:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "25vh", // Adjusted for footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Left Column */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0">
            <div className="footer-text pb-5">
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}>
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4">
            <div className="footer-image text-center d-block d-lg-none mb-4">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid"
                style={{ width: "50%" }} // Adjust the width as needed
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Change:

  • Replaced d-none d-lg-block with d-block d-lg-none on the logo's container to make it visible on mobile and hidden on desktop.

Now, the logo will appear on mobile (and hidden on desktop), and the text will align properly. If you need it to look even better on mobile, feel free to tweak the width in the inline style (style={{ width: "50%" }}) to suit the design.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

You said:
show the image at top in mobile and at right in desktop
ChatGPT said:

To achieve the desired layout where the logo is displayed at the top on mobile and to the right on desktop, you can use the responsive grid system of Bootstrap. The key is to change the order of the columns on different screen sizes.

Here's how to implement this:

  • On desktop, the logo will be on the right, and the text will be on the left.

  • On mobile, the logo will be displayed above the text.

This can be done using the order-md-2 and order-md-1 classes for column ordering.

Here's the updated code:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "25vh", // Adjusted for footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-4 py-sm-1 py-sm-5">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-5">
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 order-2 order-md-1">
            <div className="footer-text pb-5">
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}>
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2">
            <div className="footer-image text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "50%" }} // Adjust the width as needed
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Changes:

  • The text column (col-lg-6 p-0) has the class order-2 order-md-1, which means on mobile it will be displayed second, and on desktop (medium screens and up), it will appear first.

  • The image column (col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4) has the class order-1 order-md-2, which places the image above the text on mobile and to the right of the text on desktop.

This approach ensures that the logo appears at the top on mobile and on the right on desktop without needing any custom media queries.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaLinkedin size={30} /> </a> </div> </div> </div> {/* Right Column (Image) */} <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2"> <div className="footer-image text-center"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Footer Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "20%" }} // Adjust the width as needed /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default Footer;
ChatGPT said:

To reduce the height of the footer, you can adjust the minHeight and padding in the CSS styles. Currently, the minHeight value of 200px has an extra space after it (200 px), which is incorrect. You can remove the extra space and adjust the py-5 and py-sm-3 padding to reduce the overall height.

Here's the modified code with a smaller footer height:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-4 ps-3 ps-sm-0" // Reduced padding here
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "150px", // Adjusted for smaller footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-3 py-sm-1 py-sm-3">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-3"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 order-2 order-md-1">
            <div className="footer-text pb-2"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "0.9rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: "bold" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2">
            <div className="footer-image text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-3"
                style={{ width: "25%" }} {/* Adjusted the logo size */}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Changes:

  • minHeight: "150px": This reduces the height of the footer.

  • Reduced padding: I reduced the padding on the sections using classes like py-4, py-sm-1, and py-3 to make the footer smaller.

  • Font size adjustments: Font sizes have been reduced for headings and social media icons.

  • Logo size adjusted: The logo is now set to 25% width to fit nicely into the smaller footer.

This should make the footer smaller in height and more compact overall. Let me know how it works!

You said:
Failed to compile ./app/components/footer.tsx Error: x Unexpected token section. Expected jsx identifier ,-[/home/zaidfahad/Documents/Jukti_Iub_Web/JUKTI/app/components/footer.tsx:2:1] 2 | 3 | const Footer = () => { 4 | return ( 5 | <section : ^^^^^^^ 6 | className="footer text-main-background py-4 ps-3 ps-sm-0" // Reduced padding here 7 | style={{ 8 | position: "relative", ---- Caused by: Syntax Error This error occurred during the build process and can only be dismissed by fixing the error.
ChatGPT said:

It looks like the issue is related to the usage of section as a JSX tag, which may not be supported in your current setup due to how TypeScript or Babel is configured in your project.

To fix the issue, you can try the following:

  1. Ensure you're using JSX properly: If you're using TypeScript, make sure that the file has the .tsx extension and is being parsed properly as JSX by the TypeScript compiler. This is usually the case, but if there are build issues, it might be worth checking.

  2. Replace section with div: If the error persists, replacing the section tag with a div tag should resolve the issue, as div is a more universally supported element.

Here’s how the code will look after changing section to div:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <div
      className="footer text-main-background py-4 ps-3 ps-sm-0" // Reduced padding here
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "150px", // Adjusted for smaller footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-3 py-sm-1 py-sm-3">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-3"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 order-2 order-md-1">
            <div className="footer-text pb-2"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "0.9rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: "bold" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2">
            <div className="footer-image text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-3"
                style={{ width: "25%" }} {/* Adjusted the logo size */}
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div> {/* Changed from section to div */}
  );
};

export default Footer;

This change should resolve the compilation issue. Let me know if it works!

ChatGPT said:

To make the footer smaller, you can adjust the minHeight and padding values, as well as the font sizes. Here's an updated version of your code with reduced footer height and padding for a smaller footer:

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-4 ps-3 ps-sm-0" // Reduced padding here
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "150px", // Reduced footer height
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-3 py-sm-1 py-sm-3">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-3"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 order-2 order-md-1">
            <div className="footer-text pb-3"> {/* Reduced padding here */}
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-2" style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "0.9rem" }}> {/* Reduced font size */}
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }} {/* Adjusted font size */}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-2"> {/* Reduced margin */}
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-2"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.3rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={25} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-2"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.3rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={25} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-2"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.3rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={25} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.3rem" }} {/* Reduced font size */}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={25} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2">
            <div className="footer-image text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-3"
                style={{ width: "20%" }} // Adjusted width to reduce logo size
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Changes made:

  1. Padding and margin: I reduced the padding values in various elements to make the footer shorter (py-4 and py-3).

  2. Font sizes: I reduced the font sizes of the text and social icons to make the footer more compact.

  3. Logo size: Adjusted the logo width to 20% for a smaller logo.

Let me know if this works!

To make the Swiper section look more professional, we can enhance its layout, improve typography, and add consistent spacing and styling to the Swiper container and individual slides. Here's an updated version of your component with better styling and responsive design:

CSS:

css
/* Add styles for the swiper section */
.section {
  position: relative;
  background-color: #081420;
  padding-top: 60px;
  padding-bottom: 60px;
}

/* Swiper container */
.swiper-container {
  max-width: 100%;
  margin: 0 auto;
  padding: 20px;
}

.swiper-slide {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
  background-color: #fff;
  border-radius: 10px;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
  overflow: hidden;
  position: relative;
}

/* Image styling */
.swiper-slide img {
  width: 100%;
  height: auto;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

/* Content inside each slide */
.down-content {
  position: absolute;
  bottom: 20px;
  left: 20px;
  right: 20px;
  background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.7);
  padding: 20px;
  border-radius: 10px;
  color: #fff;
}

.down-content h4 {
  font-size: 1.5rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}

.down-content p {
  font-size: 1rem;
  margin-bottom: 20px;
}

.text-button-pay a {
  color: #ff7f00;
  font-weight: bold;
  text-decoration: none;
  font-size: 1rem;
  display: inline-block;
  padding: 10px 15px;
  border-radius: 5px;
  background-color: #fff;
}

.text-button-pay a:hover {
  background-color: #ff7f00;
  color: #fff;
  transition: all 0.3s ease;
}

/* Styling for the heading */
.display-6 {
  font-size: 2.5rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
}

.border-line {
  border-top: 2px solid #ff7f00;
  width: 50px;
  margin: 20px auto;
}

Updated React component:

tsx
import React from "react";
import { Swiper, SwiperSlide } from "swiper/react";
import "swiper/css";
import "swiper/css/effect-coverflow";
import "swiper/css/pagination";
import { EffectCoverflow, Pagination, Autoplay } from "swiper";

const SwiperSection = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <section
        className="section events bg-dark-navy"
        data-section="section4"
        style={{
          position: "relative",
          backgroundColor: "#081420",
          minHeight: "60vh",
        }}
      >
        <div className="custom-shape-divider-top-1686612771">
          <svg
            data-name="Layer 1"
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            viewBox="0 0 1200 120"
            preserveAspectRatio="none"
          >
            <path
              d="M1200 120L0 16.48 0 0 1200 0 1200 120z"
              className="shape-fill"
            ></path>
          </svg>
        </div>

        <div className="container-fluid pt-5">
          <h2 className="display-6 fw-bold text-white text-center pt-2">
            Activities
          </h2>
          <div className="border-bot1 d-flex justify-content-center">
            <div className="border-line"></div>
          </div>
          <div className="row pt-0">
            <div className="col-md-12">
              <div className="section-heading">
                <a href="/pastevent.html" className="btn btn-outline-orange">
                  Jukti's Journey
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
            <Swiper
              effect={"coverflow"}
              grabCursor={true}
              centeredSlides={true}
              slidesPerView={"auto"}
              coverflowEffect={{
                rotate: 10,
                stretch: 0,
                depth: 100,
                modifier: 1,
                slideShadows: true,
              }}
              autoplay={{
                delay: 2500,
                disableOnInteraction: false,
              }}
              pagination={true}
              modules={[EffectCoverflow, Pagination, Autoplay]}
              className="mySwiper"
            >
              <SwiperSlide>
                <img src="img/Events/e1.PNG" alt="Event #1" />
                <div className="down-content">
                  <h4>Android App Dev Training</h4>
                  <p>
                    Program details: Room: Gallery - 5002 (level - 4)
                    <br />
                    • 1st Day (May 28, 2015 - Thursday) <br />
                    • 2nd Day (May 29, 2015 - Friday) <br />
                    • 3rd Day (May 30, 2015 - Saturday)
                  </p>
                  <div className="text-button-pay">
                    <a href="#">
                      View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right"></i>
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </SwiperSlide>
              <SwiperSlide>
                <img src="img/Events/e2.PNG" alt="Event #2" />
                <div className="down-content">
                  <h4>Python Workshop</h4>
                  <p>
                    JUKTI - Official Club of CSE brings you a series of workshops
                    on Python
                    <br />
                    Date: 6th February, 2020 (Every Thursday & Saturday)
                  </p>
                  <div className="text-button-pay">
                    <a href="#">
                      View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right"></i>
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </SwiperSlide>
              {/* Add other SwiperSlides similarly */}
            </Swiper>
          </div>
        </div>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default SwiperSection;

Key Updates:

  1. Styling for Swiper Slide: Each slide has a rounded border and a subtle shadow for a cleaner and more professional appearance.

  2. Improved Content Layout: The content within each slide is positioned over the image, with a transparent dark background to ensure good readability.

  3. Button Hover Effect: Added a smooth hover effect for the "View More" button to make it more interactive.

  4. Responsiveness: The images and text are designed to adapt better on different screen sizes, ensuring the layout looks good on both mobile and desktop views.

These changes should give your Swiper section a polished, modern, and professional look!
