Please try again later."); } finally { setLoading(false); } }; return ( <> <section className="bg-dark-navy "> <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 className="display-1 text-light text-center">Recruitment Result</h2> <p className="text-light text-center lead"> Applied to become a member? </p> </div> </section> <div className="container my-5 custom-mg"> <div className="row justify-content-center"> <div className="col-lg-6 col-md-8 col-sm-10"> <div className="card p-4 shadow border-0"> <h3 className="fw-bold text-center text-orange"> Application Status </h3> <p className="text-center"> Enter your student ID to check application status: </p> <input type="text" className="form-control mb-3" placeholder="Enter Student ID" value={studentId} onChange={(e) => setStudentId(e.target.value)} style={{ borderColor: "#ff6600" }} /> <button className="btn btn-orange w-100" onClick={checkStatus} disabled={loading} > {loading ? "Checking..." : "Check Status"} </button> {status && ( <div className={mt-3 alert ${ status === "Approved" ? "alert-success-dark" : status === "Rejected" ? "alert-fail-dark" : "alert-warning" }} > {status} </div> )} </div> </div> </div> </div> </> ); }; export default Result;
ChatGPT said:

To add spacing around the card, you can add margin classes (m-3, m-4, etc.) to the card's container (<div className="card ...">) or apply custom styles.

Here's the updated version with spacing around the card:

Updated Code:

jsx
"use client";

import React, { useState } from "react";
import axios from "axios";
import "./result.css";

const Result = () => {
  const [studentId, setStudentId] = useState("");
  const [status, setStatus] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);

  const checkStatus = async () => {
    if (!studentId) {
      setStatus("Please enter a valid student ID.");
      return;
    }
    setLoading(true);
    setStatus("");

    try {
      // const response = await axios.get(`/api/status?id=${studentId}`);
      // const result = response.data.status;
      const result = "Rejected";
      if (result === "Approved" || result === "Rejected") {
        setStatus(result);
      } else {
        setStatus("ID not found");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      setStatus("Error retrieving status. Please try again later.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy ">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light text-center">Recruitment Result</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Applied to become a member?
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>
      <div className="container my-5 custom-mg">
        <div className="row justify-content-center">
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-md-8 col-sm-10">
            <div className="card p-4 shadow border-0 m-4"> {/* Added m-4 for spacing */}
              <h3 className="fw-bold text-center text-orange">
                Application Status
              </h3>
              <p className="text-center">
                Enter your student ID to check application status:
              </p>
              <input
                type="text"
                className="form-control mb-3"
                placeholder="Enter Student ID"
                value={studentId}
                onChange={(e) => setStudentId(e.target.value)}
                style={{ borderColor: "#ff6600" }}
              />
              <button
                className="btn btn-orange w-100"
                onClick={checkStatus}
                disabled={loading}
              >
                {loading ? "Checking..." : "Check Status"}
              </button>
              {status && (
                <div
                  className={`mt-3 alert ${
                    status === "Approved"
                      ? "alert-success-dark"
                      : status === "Rejected"
                      ? "alert-fail-dark"
                      : "alert-warning"
                  }`}
                >
                  {status}
                </div>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </>
  );
};

export default Result;

Key Updates:

  1. Added m-4 to Card: This class adds margin around the card. You can adjust it with other values like m-3, m-5, or use custom CSS for more precise control.

Optional Custom CSS (if needed):

If you want more specific control over the spacing, you can also add custom margin in your result.css:

css
.custom-card {
  margin: 20px;
}

Then, add the class custom-card to the <div className="card p-4 shadow border-0">:

jsx
<div className="card p-4 shadow border-0 custom-card">

This will add custom spacing around the card based on the CSS you define.

You said:
dont use client side
ChatGPT said:

If you want to remove the "use client" directive and handle this server-side in Next.js, you can convert your component to work without it. For server-side rendering (SSR) in Next.js, you can skip the use of React hooks like useState and useEffect if you don't need client-side interactivity, or you can handle it in a more server-friendly way (e.g., via API calls).

Here’s how you can modify the code to remove "use client" and handle the status checking in a server-side way:

Server-Side Version of Result Component (No Client-Side React Hooks):

  1. Move the logic to API calls: You can create a Next.js API route to handle the status check, then call this API on the server side.

  2. Modify the Component: To avoid the "use client" directive, we'll move the logic into the API call and fetch the result directly from the server.

Updated Code:

  1. Create an API Route (app/api/status/route.ts):

ts
// app/api/status/route.ts

import { NextResponse } from "next/server";

export async function GET(request: Request) {
  const url = new URL(request.url);
  const studentId = url.searchParams.get("id");

  if (!studentId) {
    return NextResponse.json({ status: "ID not found" }, { status: 400 });
  }

  // Simulate status check (replace with actual API logic)
  const result = "Rejected";  // This can be dynamic, querying from a database, etc.

  return NextResponse.json({ status: result });
}

  1. Update the Result Component:

This is a simplified version that assumes you are fetching the result on the server side. The form submission will trigger an API call and display the result.

tsx
// app/components/result.tsx

import React, { useState } from "react";
import axios from "axios";
import "./result.css";

const Result = () => {
  const [studentId, setStudentId] = useState("");
  const [status, setStatus] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);

  const checkStatus = async () => {
    if (!studentId) {
      setStatus("Please enter a valid student ID.");
      return;
    }
    setLoading(true);
    setStatus("");

    try {
      const response = await axios.get(`/api/status?id=${studentId}`);
      const result = response.data.status;

      if (result === "Approved" || result === "Rejected") {
        setStatus(result);
      } else {
        setStatus("ID not found");
      }
    } catch (error) {
      setStatus("Error retrieving status. Please try again later.");
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy ">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light text-center">Recruitment Result</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Applied to become a member?
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>
      <div className="container my-5 custom-mg">
        <div className="row justify-content-center">
          <div className="col-lg-6 col-md-8 col-sm-10">
            <div className="card p-4 shadow border-0 m-4">
              <h3 className="fw-bold text-center text-orange">
                Application Status
              </h3>
              <p className="text-center">
                Enter your student ID to check application status:
              </p>
              <input
                type="text"
                className="form-control mb-3"
                placeholder="Enter Student ID"
                value={studentId}
                onChange={(e) => setStudentId(e.target.value)}
                style={{ borderColor: "#ff6600" }}
              />
              <button
                className="btn btn-orange w-100"
                onClick={checkStatus}
                disabled={loading}
              >
                {loading ? "Checking..." : "Check Status"}
              </button>
              {status && (
                <div
                  className={`mt-3 alert ${
                    status === "Approved"
                      ? "alert-success-dark"
                      : status === "Rejected"
                      ? "alert-fail-dark"
                      : "alert-warning"
                  }`}
                >
                  {status}
                </div>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </>
  );
};

export default Result;

Key Changes:

  1. API Route: Created a server-side API route (/api/status) that handles the logic for checking the student ID and returning a status. This way, your component does not have to manage the logic directly and can rely on SSR.

  2. Server-Side Rendering: The form now just sends a request to the API to fetch the result, without relying on client-side React hooks for state management. The useState hook is still used for handling form state but the status retrieval is triggered by the API route instead.

Notes:

  • The axios.get call in the checkStatus function will request data from the new API endpoint.

  • In the example, the API is simulated with a static result (const result = "Rejected";). You can replace this with actual logic, such as querying a database or an external service.

You said:

</span> </h1> <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}> The Official Club of the Department of CSE </h4> <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}> <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh. </p> <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}> Email:{" "} <a href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com" className="text-white" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }} > jukti.iub@gmail.com </a> </p> <div className="social-icons mt-3"> <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaFacebook size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.twitter.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaTwitter size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="text-white me-3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaInstagram size={30} /> </a> <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="text-white" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaLinkedin size={30} /> </a> </div> </div> </div> {/* Right Column (Image) */} <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2"> <div className="footer-image text-center"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Footer Image" className="img-fluid mb-5" style={{ width: "20%" }} // Adjust the width as needed /> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> ); }; export default Footer;
ChatGPT said:

To ensure that the footer always stays at the bottom of the page, even when the content above it is not enough to fill the entire viewport, you can use Flexbox or CSS Grid to manage the layout. Here's how you can modify your layout to achieve this:

  1. Use min-height: 100vh on the body or wrapper element, and set the main content to take the remaining space.

  2. The footer can then be positioned at the bottom with margin-top: auto in a flex container.

Solution: Using Flexbox

You'll want to wrap your page content in a container that uses flexbox to fill the height, ensuring the footer stays at the bottom when there's not enough content.

Updated Code:

  1. Modify your RootLayout or the main wrapper element to use flexbox.

tsx
// app/layout.tsx or any main wrapper component

import React from "react";
import Footer from "./components/footer";
import NavBar from "./components/navbar";

export default function RootLayout({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  return (
    <div style={{ display: "flex", flexDirection: "column", minHeight: "100vh" }}>
      <NavBar />
      <main style={{ flex: "1" }}>
        {children}
      </main>
      <Footer />
    </div>
  );
}

  1. Update the Footer Component:

You don't need to make significant changes to your footer itself, but you can adjust its container to allow proper alignment. I’ve removed the minHeight and ensured that the footer’s container does not disrupt the layout.

tsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5 ps-3 ps-sm-0"
      style={{
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        position: "relative",
        paddingTop: "2rem",
        paddingBottom: "2rem",
      }}
    >
      <div className="container py-3 py-sm-1 py-sm-3">
        <div className="row align-items-center py-3">
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 order-2 order-md-1">
            <div className="footer-text pb-3">
              <h1>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
              </h1>
              <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}>
                The Official Club of the Department of CSE
              </h4>
              <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}>
                <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
              </p>
              <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
                Email:{" "}
                <a
                  href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}
                >
                  jukti.iub@gmail.com
                </a>
              </p>
              <div className="social-icons mt-3">
                <a
                  href="https://www.facebook.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaFacebook size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.twitter.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaTwitter size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.instagram.com"
                  className="text-white me-3"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaInstagram size={30} />
                </a>
                <a
                  href="https://www.linkedin.com"
                  className="text-white"
                  target="_blank"
                  rel="noopener noreferrer"
                  style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
                >
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} />
                </a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-lg-6 p-0 ps-4 order-1 order-md-2">
            <div className="footer-image text-center">
              <img
                src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
                alt="Footer Image"
                className="img-fluid mb-5"
                style={{ width: "20%" }} // Adjust the width as needed
              />
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Changes:

  1. Flexbox in RootLayout: The main layout uses display: flex with flexDirection: column and minHeight: 100vh to make sure the footer stays at the bottom.

  2. Flex-1 on main: This ensures the content section (main) will take up the available space, pushing the footer to the bottom when necessary.

This should ensure that the footer remains at the bottom of the page, even when there’s not enough content to push it down.

You said:
maked check student id is 7 digit const checkStatus = async () => { if (lenstudentId) { setStatus("Please enter a valid student ID."); return; }
ChatGPT said:

To ensure the student ID is exactly 7 digits long, you can modify the checkStatus function by checking if the length of studentId is exactly 7 and if it contains only numeric values. Here's how you can update the code:

tsx
const checkStatus = async () => {
  // Check if student ID is not exactly 7 digits or is not a number
  if (studentId.length !== 7 || isNaN(Number(studentId))) {
    setStatus("Please enter a valid 7-digit student ID.");
    return;
  }

  setLoading(true);
  setStatus("");

  try {
    // Replace this mock response with your API call logic
    const result = "Rejected"; // Example result
    if (result === "Approved" || result === "Rejected") {
      setStatus(result);
    } else {
      setStatus("ID not found");
    }
  } catch (error) {
    setStatus("Error retrieving status. Please try again later.");
  } finally {
    setLoading(false);
  }
};

Explanation:

  • The check studentId.length !== 7 || isNaN(Number(studentId)) ensures that the student ID is exactly 7 characters long and is a number.

  • If either of the conditions fails, it will show the status message Please enter a valid 7-digit student ID..

You said:
remove firebase make static "use client"; import '../globals.css'; import React from "react"; import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container'; import Row from 'react-bootstrap/Row'; import { useEffect } from "react"; import {initializeApp} from 'firebase/app'; import { getDatabase, ref, onValue, } from "firebase/database"; const page = () => { useEffect(() => { const firebaseConfig = { apiKey: "AIzaSyA3dtVO3w9L9PD7pEaHX9WdMAw8P8pxRgg", authDomain: "jukti-official-club-of-cse.firebaseapp.com", databaseURL: "https://jukti-official-club-of-cse-default-rtdb.asia-southeast1.firebasedatabase.app", projectId: "jukti-official-club-of-cse", storageBucket: "jukti-official-club-of-cse.appspot.com", messagingSenderId: "464261726994", appId: "1:464261726994:web:98e30dc02f5f2f078da9cb", }; // Initialize Firebase const app = initializeApp(firebaseConfig); const database = getDatabase(app); const advisor = ref(database, "Board"); const executive = ref(database, "Executive"); addAdvisor(); addExecutive(); function addAdvisor() { const advise = document.getElementById("advisor"); onValue(advisor, function (snapshot) { const advisors = Object.values(snapshot.val()); for (let i = 0; i < advisors.length; i++) { if(advise!=null) advise.innerHTML += <div class="col-lg-4"> <div class="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card"> <div> <div style="height: 150px;"> <div class="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div> </div> <div class="bg-dark-navy" style="height: 80px;"></div> <div class="floating-image"> <img src='${advisors[i]["Image"]}' height="150px" width="150px" style="border-radius: 50%; } }); } function addExecutive() { let execute = document.getElementById("executive"); onValue(executive, function (snapshot) { let executives = Object.values(snapshot.val()); for (let i = 0; i < executives.length; i++) { if(execute!=null) execute.innerHTML += <div class="col-lg-4"> <div class="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card"> <div> <div style="height: 150px;"> <div class="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div> </div> <div class="bg-dark-navy" style="height: 80px;"></div> <div class="floating-image"> <img src='${executives[i]["Image"]}' height="150px" width="150px" style="border-radius: 50%; border: 5px solid" class="border-orange"> </div> </div> <div class="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white "> <h2 class="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">${executives[i]["Name"]}</h2> <h5 class="text-center py-1">${executives[i]["Position"]}</h5> </div> <div class="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom"> <div class="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3"> <a href="https://www.flaticon.com/free-icons/facebook" title="facebook icons" class="m-1"> <i class="fa-brands fa-facebook" style="color: #f97924;"></i></a> <a href="https://www.flaticon.com/free-icons/linkedin" title="linkedin icons" class="m-1"><i class="fa-brands fa-linkedin-in" style="color: #f97924;"></i></a> <a href="https://www.flaticon.com/free-icons/instagram" title="instagram icons" class="m-1"><i class="fa-brands fa-instagram" style="color: #f97924;"></i></a> </div> </div> </div> </div>; } }); } }); return ( <> <section class="bg-dark-navy"> <div class="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 class="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2> <p class="text-light text-center lead"> Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering. </p> </div> </section> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center"> Advisory Board </h1> <Container > <Row id="advisor"></Row> </Container> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center"> Executive Board </h1> <Container > <Row id="executive"></Row> </Container> </> ); }; export default page;
ChatGPT said:

To remove Firebase and make the content static, you can hard-code the data for the advisory and executive board members in your component. Here's how you can update the code:

  1. Remove the Firebase initialization and the code fetching data from Firebase.

  2. Hardcode the data for advisors and executives.

  3. Map over the data to display the content dynamically.

Here’s the modified version of your code:

tsx
import '../globals.css';
import React from "react";
import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container';
import Row from 'react-bootstrap/Row';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';

const page = () => {
  // Hardcoded data for Advisor and Executive board members
  const advisors = [
    {
      Name: "John Doe",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/img/john_doe.jpg",
    },
    {
      Name: "Jane Smith",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/img/jane_smith.jpg",
    },
  ];

  const executives = [
    {
      Name: "Alice Johnson",
      Position: "President",
      Image: "/img/alice_johnson.jpg",
    },
    {
      Name: "Bob Lee",
      Position: "Vice President",
      Image: "/img/bob_lee.jpg",
    },
  ];

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <div className="col-lg-4" key={index}>
              <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card">
                <div>
                  <div style={{ height: "150px" }}>
                    <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div>
                  </div>
                  <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div>
                  <div className="floating-image">
                    <img
                      src={advisor.Image}
                      height="150px"
                      width="150px"
                      style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }}
                      className="border-orange"
                      alt={advisor.Name}
                    />
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white">
                  <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{advisor.Name}</h2>
                  <h5 className="text-center py-1">{advisor.Position}</h5>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom">
                  <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3">
                    <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <div className="col-lg-4" key={index}>
              <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card">
                <div>
                  <div style={{ height: "150px" }}>
                    <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div>
                  </div>
                  <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div>
                  <div className="floating-image">
                    <img
                      src={executive.Image}
                      height="150px"
                      width="150px"
                      style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }}
                      className="border-orange"
                      alt={executive.Name}
                    />
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white">
                  <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{executive.Name}</h2>
                  <h5 className="text-center py-1">{executive.Position}</h5>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom">
                  <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3">
                    <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default page;

Explanation of Changes:

  • Removed all Firebase-related code.

  • Created static arrays advisors and executives containing hardcoded data for the members.

  • Used .map() to loop over the arrays and display the advisor and executive information in the card format.

  • Each member's image, name, position, and social media links are displayed dynamically based on the static data.

You can update the data inside the advisors and executives arrays as needed. This will display the content without requiring Firebase or any client-side data fetching.

You said:
make for nextjs
ChatGPT said:

To convert your code for Next.js, we need to ensure that the structure and syntax follow Next.js conventions, especially in terms of rendering and routing. Here's the Next.js version of the previous static content:

  1. Create a new file for the page inside the pages directory.

  2. Use the Image component from next/image for optimized image handling.

  3. Adjust imports and structure according to Next.js conventions.

Steps:

  1. Create a new page (e.g., about.js) in the pages directory.

  2. Replace the img tag with Image from next/image for optimization.

Here’s the Next.js version of your page:

jsx
// pages/about.js
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';
import Image from 'next/image';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';

const About = () => {
  // Hardcoded data for Advisor and Executive board members
  const advisors = [
    {
      Name: "John Doe",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/images/john_doe.jpg",
    },
    {
      Name: "Jane Smith",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/images/jane_smith.jpg",
    },
  ];

  const executives = [
    {
      Name: "Alice Johnson",
      Position: "President",
      Image: "/images/alice_johnson.jpg",
    },
    {
      Name: "Bob Lee",
      Position: "Vice President",
      Image: "/images/bob_lee.jpg",
    },
  ];

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <div className="col-lg-4" key={index}>
              <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card">
                <div>
                  <div style={{ height: "150px" }}>
                    <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div>
                  </div>
                  <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div>
                  <div className="floating-image">
                    <Image
                      src={advisor.Image}
                      height={150}
                      width={150}
                      alt={advisor.Name}
                      style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }}
                      className="border-orange"
                    />
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white">
                  <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{advisor.Name}</h2>
                  <h5 className="text-center py-1">{advisor.Position}</h5>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom">
                  <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3">
                    <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <div className="col-lg-4" key={index}>
              <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card">
                <div>
                  <div style={{ height: "150px" }}>
                    <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div>
                  </div>
                  <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div>
                  <div className="floating-image">
                    <Image
                      src={executive.Image}
                      height={150}
                      width={150}
                      alt={executive.Name}
                      style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }}
                      className="border-orange"
                    />
                  </div>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white">
                  <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{executive.Name}</h2>
                  <h5 className="text-center py-1">{executive.Position}</h5>
                </div>
                <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom">
                  <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3">
                    <a href="https://www.facebook.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.linkedin.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                    <a href="https://www.instagram.com" className="m-1">
                      <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                    </a>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Key Differences for Next.js:

  1. Image Component: We use the Image component from next/image for optimized image loading. It also requires height and width for each image, which helps Next.js optimize it automatically.

  2. Routing: The page is created in the pages directory (pages/about.js). In Next.js, any file in this directory is automatically treated as a route.

  3. CSS: You can use global styles in globals.css or use CSS modules. Just ensure your styles are being correctly applied.

  4. Social Media Links: The social media icons (FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram) are retained and linked to respective URLs.

How to Test:

  1. Place your images in the public/images directory of your Next.js project (e.g., public/images/john_doe.jpg).

  2. Add the required react-bootstrap and react-icons packages if you haven't already:

    bash
    npm install react-bootstrap react-icons

  3. Run your Next.js project:

    bash
    npm run dev

  4. Navigate to http://localhost:3000/about to see the page.

With these changes, your page will work seamlessly in Next.js!

You said:
make component for the cards
ChatGPT said:

To make the code more modular and maintainable, we can extract the card functionality into a separate component. Here's how to refactor the code:

Step 1: Create the BoardCard Component

We'll create a new file for the BoardCard component that handles the rendering of each card (for both advisors and executives). This component will accept props like the name, position, image, and social links.

components/BoardCard.js:

jsx
// components/BoardCard.js
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';
import Image from 'next/image';

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4">
      <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card">
        <div>
          <div style={{ height: "150px" }}>
            <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div>
          </div>
          <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div>
          <div className="floating-image">
            <Image
              src={image}
              height={150}
              width={150}
              alt={name}
              style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }}
              className="border-orange"
            />
          </div>
        </div>
        <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white">
          <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{name}</h2>
          <h5 className="text-center py-1">{position}</h5>
        </div>
        <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom">
          <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3">
            {socialLinks.facebook && (
              <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1">
                <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
              </a>
            )}
            {socialLinks.linkedin && (
              <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1">
                <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
              </a>
            )}
            {socialLinks.instagram && (
              <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1">
                <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
              </a>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Step 2: Modify the About Page to Use the BoardCard Component

Now, we can import and use the BoardCard component in the About page. This will make the code more modular and easier to maintain.

pages/about.js:

jsx
// pages/about.js
import React from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/BoardCard'; // Import the new component

const About = () => {
  // Hardcoded data for Advisor and Executive board members
  const advisors = [
    {
      Name: "John Doe",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/images/john_doe.jpg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/john.doe",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-doe",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/john.doe"
      }
    },
    {
      Name: "Jane Smith",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/images/jane_smith.jpg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/jane.smith",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jane-smith",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/jane.smith"
      }
    },
  ];

  const executives = [
    {
      Name: "Alice Johnson",
      Position: "President",
      Image: "/images/alice_johnson.jpg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/alice.johnson",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/alice-johnson",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/alice.johnson"
      }
    },
    {
      Name: "Bob Lee",
      Position: "Vice President",
      Image: "/images/bob_lee.jpg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/bob.lee",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/bob-lee",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/bob.lee"
      }
    },
  ];

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={advisor.Image}
              socialLinks={advisor.SocialLinks}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={executive.Image}
              socialLinks={executive.SocialLinks}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Explanation:

  1. BoardCard Component:

    • Accepts name, position, image, and socialLinks as props.

    • The socialLinks prop is an object containing URLs for Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.

  2. About Page:

    • The About page imports the BoardCard component and uses it to render each member of the advisory and executive boards.

    • We map over the advisors and executives arrays, passing the required data as props to BoardCard.

Benefits of This Approach:

  • Code Reusability: The BoardCard component can be reused anywhere in the application where a similar card layout is needed.

  • Maintainability: If you need to change the structure of the cards, you only need to update the BoardCard component.

  • Modularity: The About page is cleaner and more modular, focusing only on rendering the list of cards rather than the implementation details of each card.

Now, the card logic is encapsulated in its own component, making it easier to manage and extend in the future.

You said:
make the bg whirte. make look proffesional fix spacing // components/BoardCard.js import React from 'react'; import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa'; import Image from 'next/image'; const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => { return ( <div className="col-lg-4"> <div className="card border m-lg-5 rounded narrower-card"> <div> <div style={{ height: "150px" }}> <div className="text-right text-orange font-semibold p-3">JUKTI</div> </div> <div className="bg-dark-navy" style={{ height: "80px" }}></div> <div className="floating-image"> <Image src={image} height={150} width={150} alt={name} style={{ borderRadius: "50%", border: "5px solid" }} className="border-orange" /> </div> </div> <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white"> <h2 className="text-center fs-5 font-bold py-1">{name}</h2> <h5 className="text-center py-1">{position}</h5> </div> <div className="text-center bg-dark-navy text-white rounded-bottom"> <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center m-3"> {socialLinks.facebook && ( <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1"> <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.linkedin && ( <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1"> <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.instagram && ( <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1"> <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} </div> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default BoardCard;
ChatGPT said:

To make the card look more professional, with a clean white background, and improved spacing, we can make some styling adjustments. Here’s the updated version of the BoardCard component with a refined design:

Updated components/BoardCard.js:

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';
import Image from 'next/image';

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4">
      <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
        <div className="card-body p-4">
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="mb-3">
              <Image
                src={image}
                height={150}
                width={150}
                alt={name}
                className="rounded-circle border border-5 border-primary"
              />
            </div>
            <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2>
            <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5>
          </div>
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
              {socialLinks.facebook && (
                <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.linkedin && (
                <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.instagram && (
                <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Key Changes:

  1. White Background and Clean Design:

    • The card now has a white background with a shadow-lg for a subtle professional look.

    • Removed unnecessary sections like the "JUKTI" branding inside the card header for a cleaner look.

    • Added spacing around the content (p-4 padding inside the card).

  2. Improved Layout:

    • Centering the image and text using text-center and mb-3 for better spacing.

    • Rounded Circle Image: The image has a border and is styled with rounded-circle, making it look more polished.

    • Adjusted the margin between the name, position, and social links for better spacing.

  3. Social Links:

    • The social icons are now spaced with gap-3 for better alignment and readability.

    • Added target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer" to links for better security and UX.

  4. Card Borders and Shadows:

    • The card has border-0 to remove the default borders and uses shadow-lg to add a subtle shadow for a modern, professional feel.

Result:

This approach improves the overall appearance of the card, making it look professional and clean, with well-spaced sections and a polished layout. The card will now have a smooth, minimalistic design that focuses on the content, with social links and images clearly visible and properly aligned.

ChatGPT said:

Sure! To keep the orange circle around the image, I'll update the code to retain that style. Here's the revised BoardCard component:

Updated components/BoardCard.js (with orange circle):

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';
import Image from 'next/image';

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4">
      <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
        <div className="card-body p-4">
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="mb-3">
              <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange">
                <Image
                  src={image}
                  height={150}
                  width={150}
                  alt={name}
                  className="rounded-circle"
                />
              </div>
            </div>
            <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2>
            <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5>
          </div>
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
              {socialLinks.facebook && (
                <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.linkedin && (
                <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.instagram && (
                <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Key Changes:

  1. Orange Circle Around Image:

    • I wrapped the Image component inside a div with d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange to create an orange circle around the image. This will ensure the image stays within an orange-bordered circle.

  2. Image Styling:

    • The Image component still uses the rounded-circle class to keep the image circular, while the surrounding div with border-orange ensures the orange border stays.

Result:

Now, the profile image will be surrounded by an orange circle, maintaining the styling you requested. The overall layout remains clean and professional.

You said:
where to place the images
ChatGPT said:

To place the images in a Next.js project, you should store them in the public directory. The public directory in Next.js is used to store static files like images, fonts, or icons that can be accessed directly via the root URL.

Steps to Place the Images:

  1. Place your images in the public folder:

    • Create a folder named images (or any other name you'd prefer) inside the public directory.

    • Upload your images (e.g., advisor1.jpg, advisor2.jpg) into this folder.

    Example structure:

    bash
    /public
  /images
    advisor1.jpg
    advisor2.jpg
    executive1.jpg
    executive2.jpg

  2. Referencing Images in your Components:

    • Once the images are in the public/images folder, you can reference them in your Next.js components using a relative path starting from the public directory (you don't need to add /public in the path).

    For example, in your BoardCard component:

    jsx
    <Image
  src="/images/advisor1.jpg" // Path relative to the 'public' folder
  height={150}
  width={150}
  alt={name}
  className="rounded-circle"
/>

    • Note: Since public is the root folder for static assets, you only need to specify /images/advisor1.jpg (not public/images/advisor1.jpg).

Example Usage in BoardCard.js:

If you have specific images for each advisor or executive, here’s how you can update the image prop with the correct path:

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';
import Image from 'next/image';

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4">
      <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
        <div className="card-body p-4">
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="mb-3">
              <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange">
                <Image
                  src={`/images/${image}`} // Image path from the 'public/images' folder
                  height={150}
                  width={150}
                  alt={name}
                  className="rounded-circle"
                />
              </div>
            </div>
            <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2>
            <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5>
          </div>
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
              {socialLinks.facebook && (
                <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.linkedin && (
                <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.instagram && (
                <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Example Folder Structure:

bash
/public
  /images
    advisor1.jpg
    advisor2.jpg
    executive1.jpg
    executive2.jpg
/components
  BoardCard.js
/pages
  index.js

Conclusion:

  1. Store your images in the public/images folder.

  2. Reference them in your components using relative paths like /images/advisor1.jpg.

  3. When the project is built, the images will be accessible at /images/your-image.jpg in the browser.

This method ensures your images are served statically and optimized by Next.js when deployed.

}; export default About;
ChatGPT said:

Here's your updated code with all instances of "Rasheeq Ishmum" where needed:

jsx
"use client";
import React from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card'; // Import the new component

const About = () => {
  // Hardcoded data for Advisor and Executive board members
  const advisors = [
    {
      Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - President.jpeg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/rasheeq.ishmum",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasheeq-ishmum",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/rasheeq.ishmum"
      }
    },
    {
      Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - President.jpeg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/rasheeq.ishmum",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasheeq-ishmum",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/rasheeq.ishmum"
      }
    },
    {
      Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum",
      Position: "Advisor",
      Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - President.jpeg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/rasheeq.ishmum",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasheeq-ishmum",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/rasheeq.ishmum"
      }
    },
  ];

  const executives = [
    {
      Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum",
      Position: "President",
      Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - President.jpeg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/rasheeq.ishmum",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasheeq-ishmum",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/rasheeq.ishmum"
      }
    },
    {
      Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum",
      Position: "Vice President",
      Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - President.jpeg",
      SocialLinks: {
        facebook: "https://www.facebook.com/rasheeq.ishmum",
        linkedin: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/rasheeq-ishmum",
        instagram: "https://www.instagram.com/rasheeq.ishmum"
      }
    },
  ];

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={advisor.Image}
              socialLinks={advisor.SocialLinks}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={executive.Image}
              socialLinks={executive.SocialLinks}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

In this code:

  • I've updated the Name field for all advisors and executives to "Rasheeq Ishmum."

  • I've also changed the corresponding social media links to reflect "rasheeq.ishmum."

Now, the board members will all display as "Rasheeq Ishmum" for both advisors and executives, with the image provided for each entry.

You said:
fix the nav, doesnt show active color according to page "use client" import { faCalendarCheck, faHome } from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons'; import { FontAwesomeIcon } from '@fortawesome/react-fontawesome'; import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container'; import Nav from 'react-bootstrap/Nav'; import Navbar from 'react-bootstrap/Navbar'; const NavBar = () => { return ( <Navbar expand="lg" className="navbar-dark bg-dark-navy sticly-top"> <Container> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.png" alt="Jukti_logo" id="jukti_logo" /> <Navbar.Brand className="navbar-brand text-orange fs-2 fw-bold ms-2 me-auto" href="/" > JUKTI <span className="fs-6">-Official Club of CSE</span> </Navbar.Brand> <Navbar.Toggle aria-controls="basic-navbar-nav" /> <Navbar.Collapse className="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNav"> <ul className="navbar-nav ms-auto"> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3 text-orange} aria-current="page" href="/" > <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faHome} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" /> Home </Nav.Link> </li> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3} href="/eventPage" > <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faCalendarCheck} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" /> Events </Nav.Link> </li> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3 } href="/registration" > <i className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2" style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }} ></i> Registration </Nav.Link> </li> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3 } href="/result" > <i className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2" style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }} ></i> Result </Nav.Link> </li> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3 } href="/aboutUs" > <i className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-users me-2" style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }} ></i> About us </Nav.Link> </li> <li className="nav-item"> <Nav.Link className={nav-Nav.Link fs-5 me-3 } href="/contactUs" > <i className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-phone me-2" style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }} ></i> Contact us </Nav.Link> </li> </ul> </Navbar.Collapse> </Container> </Navbar> ); }; export default NavBar;
ChatGPT said:

To make the active link in the navigation bar show the correct color based on the current page, we can use the useRouter hook from Next.js to track the active page and apply a conditional class to the active link.

Here’s how you can update your NavBar component:

jsx
"use client"
import { faCalendarCheck, faHome } from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons';
import { FontAwesomeIcon } from '@fortawesome/react-fontawesome';
import { useRouter } from 'next/router'; // Import the useRouter hook
import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container';
import Nav from 'react-bootstrap/Nav';
import Navbar from 'react-bootstrap/Navbar';

const NavBar = () => {
  const router = useRouter(); // Get the current route

  // Helper function to determine if the current link is active
  const isActive = (path) => router.pathname === path ? 'active' : '';

  return (
    <Navbar expand="lg" className="navbar-dark bg-dark-navy sticly-top">
      <Container>
        <img src="/img/jukti_logo.png" alt="Jukti_logo" id="jukti_logo" />
        <Navbar.Brand
          className="navbar-brand text-orange fs-2 fw-bold ms-2 me-auto"
          href="/"
        >
          JUKTI <span className="fs-6">- Official Club of CSE</span>
        </Navbar.Brand>
        <Navbar.Toggle aria-controls="basic-navbar-nav" />
        <Navbar.Collapse className="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNav">
          <ul className="navbar-nav ms-auto">
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/')}`}
                aria-current="page"
                href="/"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faHome} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Home
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/eventPage')}`}
                href="/eventPage"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faCalendarCheck} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Events
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/registration')}`}
                href="/registration"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Registration
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/result')}`}
                href="/result"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Result
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/aboutUs')}`}
                href="/aboutUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-users me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                About Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/contactUs')}`}
                href="/contactUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-phone me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Contact Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
          </ul>
        </Navbar.Collapse>
      </Container>
    </Navbar>
  );
};

export default NavBar;

Key Changes:

  1. useRouter: The useRouter hook is used to get the current route (router.pathname).

  2. isActive function: This function checks if the current route matches the link's path. If it does, it adds the active class to that link.

  3. CSS for active state: You can style the active links in your CSS, e.g.:

    css
    .nav-link.active {
  color: #f97924; /* Or any other color for the active link */
}

With this setup, the navigation links will highlight in the active color when the user is on the respective page.

You said:
Unhandled Runtime Error Error: NextRouter was not mounted. https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/next-router-not-mounted
ChatGPT said:

The error occurs because the useRouter hook from Next.js is only available in the client-side and needs to be run inside a component that is rendered on the client.

Since your NavBar is used inside a Next.js app with use client, the error suggests the hook is being called outside the client-side context.

To resolve this, you need to ensure that useRouter is only used in a client-side component, especially when running the app in a server-side rendering context.

Here's how to fix the issue:

  1. Wrap the useRouter hook with a client-side check, using useEffect to ensure it runs only in the client-side context.

Here is the updated NavBar component:

jsx
"use client"
import { faCalendarCheck, faHome } from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons';
import { FontAwesomeIcon } from '@fortawesome/react-fontawesome';
import { useRouter } from 'next/router'; // Import the useRouter hook
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; // Import useEffect and useState
import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container';
import Nav from 'react-bootstrap/Nav';
import Navbar from 'react-bootstrap/Navbar';

const NavBar = () => {
  const [isClient, setIsClient] = useState(false);
  const router = useRouter();

  useEffect(() => {
    setIsClient(true); // Set isClient to true once the component is mounted on the client
  }, []);

  // If not rendered on the client, return null
  if (!isClient) return null;

  // Helper function to determine if the current link is active
  const isActive = (path) => router.pathname === path ? 'active' : '';

  return (
    <Navbar expand="lg" className="navbar-dark bg-dark-navy sticly-top">
      <Container>
        <img src="/img/jukti_logo.png" alt="Jukti_logo" id="jukti_logo" />
        <Navbar.Brand
          className="navbar-brand text-orange fs-2 fw-bold ms-2 me-auto"
          href="/"
        >
          JUKTI <span className="fs-6">- Official Club of CSE</span>
        </Navbar.Brand>
        <Navbar.Toggle aria-controls="basic-navbar-nav" />
        <Navbar.Collapse className="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNav">
          <ul className="navbar-nav ms-auto">
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/')}`}
                aria-current="page"
                href="/"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faHome} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Home
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/eventPage')}`}
                href="/eventPage"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faCalendarCheck} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Events
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/registration')}`}
                href="/registration"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Registration
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/result')}`}
                href="/result"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Result
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/aboutUs')}`}
                href="/aboutUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-users me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                About Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/contactUs')}`}
                href="/contactUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-phone me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Contact Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
          </ul>
        </Navbar.Collapse>
      </Container>
    </Navbar>
  );
};

export default NavBar;

Explanation of Changes:

  1. useState and useEffect: We introduced useState to manage a state variable (isClient) and useEffect to set it to true once the component has mounted on the client side. This ensures that the component is only rendered after the page has been mounted.

  2. Client-side check: Before using useRouter, we check if the component has been mounted on the client side. If not, the component returns null, preventing the error.

  3. isActive function: It checks if the current route matches the link’s path, and adds the active class conditionally.

This should fix the "NextRouter was not mounted" error and correctly highlight the active navigation link based on the current page.

You said:
Unhandled Runtime Error Error: NextRouter was not mounted. https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/next-router-not-mounted Source app/components/navbar.tsx (12:26) @ useRouter 10 | const NavBar = () => { 11 | const [isClient, setIsClient] = useState(false); > 12 | const router = useRouter(); | ^ 13 | 14 | useEffect(() => { 15 | setIsClient(true); // Set isClient to true once the component is mounted on the client
ChatGPT said:

It looks like you're still facing the issue where the useRouter hook is trying to be used before the Next.js Router is fully mounted. The error happens because in Next.js, the useRouter hook is not available on the server side, and you're trying to access it in the initial render (which may occur server-side before the client-side JavaScript runs).

To solve this, we need to ensure that the useRouter hook is only called on the client side. We can achieve this by using a useEffect hook to delay accessing the router until after the initial server-side rendering. This is necessary in Next.js because the useRouter hook is only available once the component is mounted on the client-side.

Here's an updated version of your NavBar component that fixes this issue:

Solution:

tsx
"use client"
import { faCalendarCheck, faHome } from '@fortawesome/free-solid-svg-icons';
import { FontAwesomeIcon } from '@fortawesome/react-fontawesome';
import { useRouter } from 'next/router'; // Import the useRouter hook
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; // Import useEffect and useState
import Container from 'react-bootstrap/Container';
import Nav from 'react-bootstrap/Nav';
import Navbar from 'react-bootstrap/Navbar';

const NavBar = () => {
  const [isClient, setIsClient] = useState(false); // State to track if we're on the client-side
  const [activePath, setActivePath] = useState(''); // State to store active path
  const router = useRouter();

  // This effect will run only once, when the component mounts
  useEffect(() => {
    setIsClient(true); // Set to true after mounting on the client side
    setActivePath(router.pathname); // Set the active path on mount
  }, [router.pathname]);

  // If we're not on the client yet, render nothing (avoid using router)
  if (!isClient) return null;

  // Helper function to determine if the current link is active
  const isActive = (path: string) => activePath === path ? 'active' : '';

  return (
    <Navbar expand="lg" className="navbar-dark bg-dark-navy sticly-top">
      <Container>
        <img src="/img/jukti_logo.png" alt="Jukti_logo" id="jukti_logo" />
        <Navbar.Brand
          className="navbar-brand text-orange fs-2 fw-bold ms-2 me-auto"
          href="/"
        >
          JUKTI <span className="fs-6">- Official Club of CSE</span>
        </Navbar.Brand>
        <Navbar.Toggle aria-controls="basic-navbar-nav" />
        <Navbar.Collapse className="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNav">
          <ul className="navbar-nav ms-auto">
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/')}`}
                aria-current="page"
                href="/"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faHome} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Home
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/eventPage')}`}
                href="/eventPage"
              >
                <FontAwesomeIcon icon={faCalendarCheck} className="me-2 d-inline d-lg-none" />
                Events
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/registration')}`}
                href="/registration"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Registration
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/result')}`}
                href="/result"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-user-pen me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Result
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/aboutUs')}`}
                href="/aboutUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-users me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                About Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
            <li className="nav-item">
              <Nav.Link
                className={`nav-link fs-5 me-3 ${isActive('/contactUs')}`}
                href="/contactUs"
              >
                <i
                  className="d-inline d-lg-none fa-solid fa-phone me-2"
                  style={{ color: "#f7f6ee" }}
                ></i>
                Contact Us
              </Nav.Link>
            </li>
          </ul>
        </Navbar.Collapse>
      </Container>
    </Navbar>
  );
};

export default NavBar;

Key Changes:

  1. useEffect for Client-Side Rendering: We added the useEffect hook to ensure that the useRouter hook is only accessed on the client side (after the component has mounted).

  2. Tracking Active Path: The activePath state is used to store the current page's path (router.pathname) and compare it with the path of each navigation link.

  3. isActive Function: This function compares the current path (activePath) with the path of each link. If they match, it adds the active class to the corresponding Nav.Link component.

This way, the error will be resolved, and the active state for each navigation link will be correctly applied.

You said:
suggest me a simple way to create a backend for this "use client"; import React, { useState } from "react"; import axios from "axios"; import "./result.css"; const Result = () => { const [studentId, setStudentId] = useState(""); const [status, setStatus] = useState(""); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false); const checkStatus = async () => { if (studentId.length !== 7 || isNaN(Number(studentId))) { setStatus("Please enter a valid student ID."); return; } setLoading(true); setStatus(""); try { // const response = await axios.get(/api/status?id=${studentId}); // const result = response.data.status; const result = "Rejected"; if (result === "Approved" || result === "Rejected") { setStatus(result); } else { setStatus("ID not found"); } } catch (error) { setStatus("Error retrieving status. Please try again later."); } finally { setLoading(false); } }; return ( <> <section className="bg-dark-navy "> <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 className="display-1 text-light text-center">Recruitment Result</h2> <p className="text-light text-center lead"> Applied to become a member? </p> </div> </section> <div className="container my-5 custom-mg"> <div className="row justify-content-center"> <div className="col-lg-6 col-md-8 col-sm-10"> <div className="card p-4 shadow border-0 m-4"> {/* Added m-4 for spacing */} <h3 className="fw-bold text-center text-orange"> Application Status </h3> <p className="text-center"> Enter your student ID to check application status: </p> <input type="text" className="form-control mb-3" placeholder="Enter Student ID" value={studentId} onChange={(e) => setStudentId(e.target.value)} style={{ borderColor: "#ff6600" }} /> <button className="btn btn-orange w-100" onClick={checkStatus} disabled={loading} > {loading ? "Checking..." : "Check Status"} </button> {status && ( <div className={mt-3 alert ${ status === "Approved" ? "alert-success-dark" : status === "Rejected" ? "alert-fail-dark" : "alert-warning" }} > {status} </div> )} </div> </div> </div> </div> </> ); }; export default Result;
ChatGPT said:

To create a simple backend for this React component, you can use Next.js API routes since you're already using Next.js for the frontend. Next.js API routes allow you to write backend code directly within your Next.js project without needing an external server. Here's how you can implement it:

Steps to Create a Simple Backend:

  1. Create an API Route: In your Next.js project, create an API route to handle the backend logic for checking the student's status.

  2. Mock Database or Logic: Since you're only testing the frontend, you can mock the status of the student based on their ID.

1. Create the API Route:

  • In your Next.js project, create a new API route at pages/api/status.js.

javascript
// pages/api/status.js

export default function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method === "GET") {
    const { id } = req.query;

    // Mock database logic
    if (!id || id.length !== 7 || isNaN(Number(id))) {
      return res.status(400).json({ status: "Invalid student ID." });
    }

    // Simulate student status retrieval
    const statuses = {
      "1234567": "Approved",
      "7654321": "Rejected",
    };

    const studentStatus = statuses[id];

    if (studentStatus) {
      return res.status(200).json({ status: studentStatus });
    } else {
      return res.status(404).json({ status: "ID not found." });
    }
  } else {
    return res.status(405).json({ status: "Method Not Allowed" });
  }
}

2. Update Frontend (React Component):

Now, update your Result component to call the newly created API route (/api/status) to fetch the status.

javascript
"use client";

import React, { useState } from "react";
import axios from "axios";
import "./result.css";

const Result = () => {
  const [studentId, setStudentId] = useState("");
  const [status, setStatus] = useState("");
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);

  const checkStatus = async () => {
    if (studentId.length !== 7 || isNaN(Number(studentId))) {
      setStatus("Please enter a valid student ID.");
      return;
    }
