href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/jukti-iub/" className="text-white" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }} > <FaLinkedin size={30} /> </a> </div> </div> {/* Right Column (Image) */} <div className="col-md-6 text-center"> <img src="/img/jukti_logo.webp" alt="Footer Image" className="img-fluid" style={{ width: "20%", maxWidth: "150px" }} // Responsive image size /> </div> </div> </div> {/* Credit Line */} <div className="text-center py-5" style={{ color: "#ffffff", fontSize: "0.9rem" }}> Crafted to inspire by{" "} <a href="https://zaidfahad.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ textDecoration: "none", color: "#ff6600" }} > Zaid Fahad </a> &{" "} <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/rashedur-rahman-arafat-5b6357310/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" style={{ textDecoration: "none", color: "#ff6600" }} > Rashedur Rahman </a> </div> </section> ); }; export default Footer; and margins
ChatGPT said:

The issue with the logo on mobile is likely due to the fixed width and lack of responsive scaling. Let's make the following adjustments:

  1. Use w-50 w-md-25: This ensures the logo is 50% width on mobile and 25% on larger screens.

  2. Add mx-auto: Centers the image on mobile devices.

  3. Use Flexbox Alignment: Ensures consistent alignment of text and image.

Here's the improved version:

jsx
import { FaFacebook, FaTwitter, FaInstagram, FaLinkedin } from 'react-icons/fa';

const Footer = () => {
  return (
    <section
      className="footer text-main-background py-5"
      style={{
        position: "relative",
        backgroundColor: "#081420",
        minHeight: "200px",
        overflowX: "hidden",
      }}
    >
      <div className="container-fluid p-3">
        <div className="row align-items-center text-center text-md-start">
          {/* Left Column (Text) */}
          <div className="col-md-6 mb-4 mb-md-0">
            <h1>
              <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span>
            </h1>
            <h4 className="fw-bold mb-3" style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}>
              The Official Club of the Department of CSE
            </h4>
            <p className="lead" style={{ fontSize: "1rem" }}>
              <span className="text-orange"> JUKTI </span> is the Faculty-Student Club of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Independent University, Bangladesh.
            </p>
            <p style={{ fontSize: "1.2rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}>
              Email:{" "}
              <a
                href="mailto:jukti.iub@gmail.com"
                className="text-white"
                style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem", fontWeight: "bold" }}
              >
                jukti.iub@gmail.com
              </a>
            </p>
            <div className="social-icons mt-3">
              <a
                href="https://www.facebook.com/jukti.cse.iub"
                className="text-white me-3"
                target="_blank"
                rel="noopener noreferrer"
                style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
              >
                <FaFacebook size={30} />
              </a>
              <a
                href="https://www.instagram.com/jukti.official/"
                className="text-white me-3"
                target="_blank"
                rel="noopener noreferrer"
                style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
              >
                <FaInstagram size={30} />
              </a>
              <a
                href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/jukti-iub/"
                className="text-white"
                target="_blank"
                rel="noopener noreferrer"
                style={{ fontSize: "1.5rem" }}
              >
                <FaLinkedin size={30} />
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>

          {/* Right Column (Image) */}
          <div className="col-md-6 text-center">
            <img
              src="/img/jukti_logo.webp"
              alt="Footer Logo"
              className="img-fluid mx-auto w-50 w-md-25" // Responsive image size
              style={{ maxWidth: "150px" }}
            />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      
      {/* Credit Line */}
      <div className="text-center py-5" style={{ color: "#ffffff", fontSize: "0.9rem" }}>
        Crafted to inspire by{" "}
        <a 
          href="https://zaidfahad.com" 
          target="_blank" 
          rel="noopener noreferrer"
          style={{ textDecoration: "none", color: "#ff6600" }}
        >
          Zaid Fahad
        </a> &{" "}
        <a 
          href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/rashedur-rahman-arafat-5b6357310/" 
          target="_blank" 
          rel="noopener noreferrer"
          style={{ textDecoration: "none", color: "#ff6600" }}
        >
          Rashedur Rahman
        </a>
      </div>
    </section>
  );
};

export default Footer;

Key Changes:

  • w-50 w-md-25: Adjusts the logo width for mobile (50%) and desktop (25%).

  • mx-auto: Centers the logo on mobile.

  • Consistent Alignment: Flexbox alignment fixes any margin issues.

  • Responsive Text & Layout: Maintains a clean and organized layout on all screen sizes.

This should make the logo look great on both mobile and desktop views!

You said:
i have a google sheets turn that into a rest api using appscript
ChatGPT said:

To turn a Google Sheet into a REST API using Google Apps Script, follow these steps:

✅ Step-by-Step Guide

1. Prepare Your Google Sheet

  • Make sure the first row has headers (like id, name, email, etc.).

  • The data starts from row 2.

2. Open Apps Script

  • In your Google Sheet, go to Extensions > Apps Script.

3. Paste the Script Below

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getActiveSheet();
  const rows = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  const headers = rows.shift();

  const data = rows.map(row => {
    let item = {};
    headers.forEach((key, i) => item[key] = row[i]);
    return item;
  });

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(data))
    .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

This script:

  • Reads all rows in the sheet

  • Converts them to JSON

  • Returns them in a GET request

4. Deploy as Web App

  • Go to Deploy > Manage deployments

  • Click + New deployment

  • Click Select type > Web app

  • Set:

    • Description: "Public API"

    • Execute as: Me

    • Who has access: Anyone

  • Click Deploy

  • Allow authorization if prompted

  • Copy the web app URL

✅ Result:

Visiting the URL will give you JSON data like:

json
[
  { "id": 1, "name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com" },
  { "id": 2, "name": "Bob", "email": "bob@example.com" }
]

Would you like POST, PUT, DELETE methods too for full CRUD?

You said:
i want to make seperate endpoints for each sheets
ChatGPT said:

Perfect — to create separate endpoints for each sheet in a Google Spreadsheet using Apps Script, you can modify the doGet() function to accept a query parameter like ?sheet=Sheet1, and respond with data from the corresponding sheet.

✅ Full Script with Sheet-Based Routing

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  const sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
      JSON.stringify({ error: "Missing 'sheet' parameter." })
    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
  }

  const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
      JSON.stringify({ error: `Sheet '${sheetName}' not found.` })
    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
  }

  const data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  const headers = data.shift();

  const result = data.map(row => {
    let item = {};
    headers.forEach((key, index) => {
      item[key] = row[index];
    });
    return item;
  });

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(result))
    .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

📌 Usage

Assuming your deployment URL is:

bash
https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxxxxxxx/exec

You can now call:

perl
https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxxxxxxx/exec?sheet=Sheet1
https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxxxxxxx/exec?sheet=Events
https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxxxxxxx/exec?sheet=Members

Each endpoint returns JSON for that specific sheet.

Would you like to secure the API (e.g., using an API key) or also enable POST to add new rows?

You said:
i have 4 sheets, Adviosr, EB, Active Members, Events,
ChatGPT said:

Great — here’s how you can create separate REST API endpoints for each of your four sheets using Google Apps Script:

1. Open your Google Sheets file

  • Go to Extensions > Apps Script

2. Paste the following code:

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  const sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Missing 'sheet' parameter").setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  const ss = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet();
  const sheet = ss.getSheetByName(sheetName);
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput(`Sheet '${sheetName}' not found`).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  const data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  const headers = data.shift(); // Remove the header row

  const json = data.map(row => {
    let obj = {};
    headers.forEach((header, i) => {
      obj[header] = row[i];
    });
    return obj;
  });

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(json)).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

3. Deploy your script

  • Go to Deploy > Manage deployments

  • Click + New deployment

  • Choose Web app

  • Set who can access to “Anyone”

  • Deploy and authorize

4. API Usage

Use this format to access each sheet:

perl
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Advisor
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=EB
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Active%20Members
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Events

Replace DEPLOYMENT_ID with your actual Apps Script deployment ID.

Would you like me to help format the responses or add filters to the API?

You said:
make the code more easy to understand
ChatGPT said:

Sure! Here's a simplified and beginner-friendly version of the Google Apps Script code that turns each sheet into a REST API endpoint:

✅ Easy-to-Understand Google Apps Script Code

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  // Get the sheet name from the URL parameter like ?sheet=Advisor
  var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  
  // If no sheet name is provided
  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Please provide a 'sheet' parameter in the URL.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  // Get the active Google Spreadsheet
  var spreadsheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet();
  var sheet = spreadsheet.getSheetByName(sheetName);
  
  // If the sheet is not found
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet named '" + sheetName + "' not found.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  // Get all the rows and columns from the sheet
  var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();

  // Use the first row as column headers
  var headers = data[0];
  var rows = [];

  // Loop through the remaining rows and build JSON objects
  for (var i = 1; i < data.length; i++) {
    var rowObject = {};
    for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) {
      rowObject[headers[j]] = data[i][j];
    }
    rows.push(rowObject);
  }

  // Return the data as JSON
  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(rows))
                       .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

📌 How to Use the API

  • Publish your script as a web app

  • Use the URL like this:

bash
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Advisor
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=EB
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Active%20Members
https://script.google.com/macros/s/DEPLOYMENT_ID/exec?sheet=Events

Just replace DEPLOYMENT_ID with your actual deployment ID from the web app setup.

Would you like help adding filters like searching by name or department?

You said:
1st 2 rows are header
ChatGPT said:

Thanks! Since your first two rows are headers, we’ll skip the first two rows when processing data, and use the second row (index 1) as the keys for the JSON.

Here’s the updated and easy-to-understand version of your Apps Script:

✅ Updated Script for 2 Header Rows

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  
  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Please provide a 'sheet' parameter in the URL.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var spreadsheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet();
  var sheet = spreadsheet.getSheetByName(sheetName);
  
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet named '" + sheetName + "' not found.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();

  // Use second row as headers (index 1)
  var headers = data[1]; // Second row
  var rows = [];

  // Start from third row (index 2) to get actual data
  for (var i = 2; i < data.length; i++) {
    var rowObject = {};
    for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) {
      rowObject[headers[j]] = data[i][j];
    }
    rows.push(rowObject);
  }

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(rows))
                       .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

This will:

  • Skip the first row (e.g., sheet title or category)

  • Use the second row as your field names (e.g., Name, Email, etc.)

  • Return clean JSON data starting from the third row

Do you want to restrict public access or make the data filterable by a column value (e.g., ?sheet=Advisor&name=John)?

You said:
i want the json to have headings
ChatGPT said:

Got it! You want the JSON response to include the headers (from row 2) along with the data—like this:

json
{
  "headers": ["Name", "Email", "Phone"],
  "rows": [
    { "Name": "Alice", "Email": "alice@example.com", "Phone": "123456789" },
    { "Name": "Bob", "Email": "bob@example.com", "Phone": "987654321" }
  ]
}

Here's the updated and clean Google Apps Script to do that:

✅ Google Apps Script with Headers Included in JSON

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  
  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Please provide a 'sheet' parameter in the URL.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
  
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet named '" + sheetName + "' not found.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  var headers = data[1];  // Second row (index 1) as headers
  var rows = [];

  for (var i = 2; i < data.length; i++) {  // Start from row 3 (index 2)
    var rowData = {};
    for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) {
      rowData[headers[j]] = data[i][j];
    }
    rows.push(rowData);
  }

  var result = {
    headers: headers,
    rows: rows
  };

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(result))
                       .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

You can access each sheet using a URL like:

perl
https://script.google.com/macros/s/your-script-id/exec?sheet=Advisor

Would you like to make this script public or restrict it to certain users?

You said:
not like that, i want them a json , where headers are the key and rows are the val
ChatGPT said:

Thanks for clarifying! You want a clean JSON array of objects, where each row becomes an object and the headers from row 2 are used as keys, like this:

✅ Desired JSON format:

json
[
  { "Name": "Alice", "Email": "alice@example.com", "Phone": "123456789" },
  { "Name": "Bob", "Email": "bob@example.com", "Phone": "987654321" }
]

✅ Updated Google Apps Script:

This version reads from row 2 for headers and row 3 onward for data:

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;

  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Missing 'sheet' parameter.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet '" + sheetName + "' not found.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();

  if (data.length < 3) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Not enough data (need at least 3 rows).")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var headers = data[1];  // Row 2 (index 1) is the header
  var output = [];

  for (var i = 2; i < data.length; i++) {  // Start from row 3 (index 2)
    var rowObj = {};
    for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) {
      rowObj[headers[j]] = data[i][j];
    }
    output.push(rowObj);
  }

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(output))
                       .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

📌 Example usage:

If your Apps Script is deployed as a web app, and your spreadsheet has a sheet called "Advisor", access the API like:

perl
https://script.google.com/macros/s/your-script-id/exec?sheet=Advisor

Let me know if you’d like to add filtering, sorting, or authentication to this API too.

To update your About Us page to use your REST API endpoints instead of hardcoded data, you’ll need to fetch the data from the Google Apps Script web app and populate the components dynamically.

Here’s the updated About component using useEffect and useState:

js
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch("https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor");
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const ebRes = await fetch("https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB");
        const ebData = await ebRes.json();
        setExecutives(ebData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Failed to fetch data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={advisor.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={executive.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Notes:

  • Make sure your column headers in the sheet are exactly: Name, Position, Image, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram (case-sensitive).

  • If your JSON keys differ, update the references accordingly.

  • You may want to add a loading state or error UI depending on your design.

Would you like me to help with caching or fallback loading animations?

You said:
these are the rest api links for Advisors [https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor](https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor) Executive Board [https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB](https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB) Active Members [https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members](https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members) and this is the about us page code "use client"; import React from 'react'; import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap'; import BoardCard from '../components/board\_card'; // Import the new component const About = () => { // Hardcoded data for Advisor and Executive board members const advisors = \[ { Name: "Rasheeq Ishmum", Position: "Advisor", Image: "/img/board/Rasheeq Ishmum - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering. </p> </div> </section> 
<h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
  <Container>
    <Row>
      {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
        <BoardCard
          key={index}
          name={advisor.Name}
          position={advisor.Position}
          image={advisor.Image}
          socialLinks={advisor.SocialLinks}
        />
      ))}
    </Row>
  </Container>

  <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
  <Container>
    <Row>
      {executives.map((executive, index) => (
        <BoardCard
          key={index}
          name={executive.Name}
          position={executive.Position}
          image={executive.Image}
          socialLinks={executive.SocialLinks}
        />
      ))}
    </Row>
  </Container>
</>
); }; export default About; update it to use the api
ChatGPT said:

Here's your updated About Us page with hardcoded data replaced by dynamic data from your Google Sheets REST API:

✅ Updated Code (Dynamic from API):

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={advisor.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={executive.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

📌 Requirements Recap:

  • ✅ Dynamically fetches from Google Sheets REST API.

  • ✅ Uses your existing BoardCard component.

  • ✅ Expects column headers: Name, Position, Image, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram.

Let me know if you also want to include the Active Members section or want to add loading spinners or error messages.

You said:
add a active members section after executive board
ChatGPT said:

Here's the updated About Us page with an Active Members section added after the Executive Board:

✅ Updated Code (with Active Members Section):

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={advisor.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={executive.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={member.Name}
              position={member.Position}
              image={member.Image}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: member.Facebook,
                linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                instagram: member.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

📌 Changes:

  1. Active Members Section:

    • Fetches data from the Active Members sheet.

    • Displays the members below the Executive Board.

  2. Code Flow:

    • Fetches data from all three sheets: Advisor, Executive Board, and Active Members.

    • Renders BoardCard components for each section (Advisory, Executive, Active Members).

Let me know if you need any further changes or improvements!

You said:
the images are links, make it work
ChatGPT said:

To make the images clickable as links (assuming that you want to open the image in a new tab or navigate to a specific URL when clicked), you can wrap the <img> tags inside <a> tags. Here's how you can modify the code:

Updated Code (Clickable Images):

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={
                <a href={advisor.Image} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <img
                    src={advisor.Image}
                    alt={advisor.Name}
                    style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }} // Adjust the size as needed
                  />
                </a>
              }
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center
You said:
the images are image url, the code is trying to load from assets, fix it to load from url
ChatGPT said:
You said:
the images are image url, the code is trying to load from assets, fix it to load from url
ChatGPT said:

To make the images load directly from the provided URLs, you can ensure that the image URLs from the API are used directly in the src attribute of the img tag. I'll fix the code to ensure that the images load from the URLs instead of the local assets.

Here’s the updated code:

Updated Code (with Image URLs):

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={
                <a href={advisor.Image} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <img
                    src={advisor.Image}
                    alt={advisor.Name}
                    style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }} // Adjust the size as needed
                  />
                </a>
              }
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={
                <a href={executive.Image} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <img
                    src={executive.Image}
                    alt={executive.Name}
                    style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }} // Adjust the size as needed
                  />
                </a>
              }
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={member.Name}
              position={member.Position}
              image={
                <a href={member.Image} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <img
                    src={member.Image}
                    alt={member.Name}
                    style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }} // Adjust the size as needed
                  />
                </a>
              }
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: member.Facebook,
                linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                instagram: member.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Key Changes:

  • Image URLs: The image URL for each advisor, executive, and active member is fetched directly from the API and used as the src in the img tag.

  • Clickable Images: The images are wrapped with <a> tags, making them clickable. When the image is clicked, it will open the image URL in a new tab (target="_blank").

Things to Check:

  • Ensure that the image URLs provided in the API response are direct URLs to the images and that they are accessible publicly.

  • If you want to open the images in a modal or navigate somewhere else upon clicking the image, you can modify the href in the <a> tag accordingly.

Let me know if you need further customization!

You said:
the images are not showing
ChatGPT said:

If the images aren't showing, there could be a few possible reasons why they're not rendering correctly. Here are a few things to check and fix:

Troubleshooting Steps:

  1. Check Image URLs:

    • Ensure that the image URLs are correct and publicly accessible. Try opening one of the URLs directly in your browser to see if the image loads.

  2. Check the Image URL Format:

    • Sometimes, Google Sheets URLs might be wrapped in quotes or other formats that need to be cleaned up before being used. Ensure that the URLs are in their raw form.

  3. Ensure the Image Element Is Correctly Formatted:

    • Make sure that the img tag is correctly referencing the src attribute.

Updated Code (with Fixes):

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    return (
      <img
        src={imageUrl}
        alt="Board Member"
        style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }}
        onError={(e) => { e.target.src = "/img/default-image.jpg"; }} // Fallback image if URL is broken
      />
    );
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={renderImage(executive.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={member.Name}
              position={member.Position}
              image={renderImage(member.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: member.Facebook,
                linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                instagram: member.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Key Updates:

  1. Render Image from URL:

    • The renderImage function handles rendering images directly from the URLs fetched from the API.

    • If the image fails to load (i.e., the URL is broken), a fallback image (default-image.jpg) will be shown. You can replace this with your own placeholder image.

  2. Image Handling:

    • The onError handler will load a fallback image in case the image from the URL cannot be loaded.

Next Steps:

  1. Test the URLs: Ensure the image URLs are correct and publicly accessible.

  2. Check the default-image.jpg Path: Ensure that the fallback image path (/img/default-image.jpg) exists, or you can adjust the path to an existing placeholder.

Let me know if this works or if you need further adjustments!

You said:
still not working
ChatGPT said:

Let's go through some additional checks and fixes to ensure the images load correctly.

Key things to check:

  1. Verify Image URLs:

    • Double-check that the image URLs returned from your API are correct and publicly accessible. If they are not publicly accessible, the browser will not be able to display them.

    • Paste one of the image URLs directly into the browser and ensure the image loads.

  2. Ensure URL Encoding:

    • Make sure that the URLs in the JSON response are properly formatted. Sometimes special characters (like spaces) in the URLs might need to be URL encoded.

  3. Cross-Origin Issues:

    • Ensure that the image server allows cross-origin requests. If the image server does not permit it, the browser will block the image from being loaded. This typically shows as a CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) error in the browser console.

  4. Ensure img Tag Rendering:

    • Sometimes, React doesn't re-render the img tag properly with dynamically fetched URLs. To handle this, try adding key to the img tag for forced re-render.

Updated Solution:

I'll implement these checks in the code and add more debugging to see what's happening.

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        // Fetch data for Advisors, Executive, and Active Members
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    // Check if the image URL is valid by opening it in a new tab
    const isValidUrl = (url) => {
      try {
        const img = new Image();
        img.src = url;
        return img.complete && img.naturalWidth !== 0;
      } catch (e) {
        return false;
      }
    };

    if (isValidUrl(imageUrl)) {
      return (
        <img
          src={imageUrl}
          alt="Board Member"
          style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }}
          onError={(e) => { e.target.src = "/img/default-image.jpg"; }} // Fallback image if URL is broken
        />
      );
    } else {
      return <img src="/img/default-image.jpg" alt="Default" style={{ width: "150px", height: "auto" }} />;
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={renderImage(executive.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={member.Name}
              position={member.Position}
              image={renderImage(member.Image)}  {/* Pass the image URL here */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: member.Facebook,
                linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                instagram: member.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Changes:

  1. isValidUrl Check:

    • I've added a simple URL check (isValidUrl) to ensure that the image URL is valid before rendering the image. This avoids loading broken URLs. The img.complete and img.naturalWidth !== 0 checks if the image is loaded successfully.

  2. Fallback Image:

    • If the image URL is invalid, it will fallback to the placeholder (default-image.jpg), which you should place in your assets folder. If the image URL doesn't load, this placeholder will display instead.

  3. onError Handling:

    • The onError event handler is still in place to load a fallback image if the original image URL fails to load.

Next Steps:

  1. Test Image URLs:

    • Try opening one of the image URLs in your browser. If the image shows up correctly, then the issue might be with React's rendering. If not, you need to fix the URLs in the API response.

  2. Placeholder Image:

    • Make sure the placeholder image (default-image.jpg) exists in the /img/ directory or modify it to use another fallback image you have.

  3. Check CORS:

    • If your images are hosted on a different domain, ensure that the server allows cross-origin image loading. You might see CORS-related errors in the browser console if this is the case.

If it still doesn't work, you can share an image URL you're testing with, and I'll help troubleshoot further.

You said:
Image is missing required "src" property: <img alt=​"John Doe" width=​"150" height=​"150" decoding=​"async" data-nimg=​"1" class=​"rounded-circle" src style>​ window.console.error @ app-index.js:33
ChatGPT said:

The error you're encountering, "Image is missing required 'src' property", suggests that React is attempting to render an img tag without a valid src attribute.

This error is typically caused by either:

  1. An empty or invalid image property passed to the BoardCard component.

  2. A condition in the renderImage function not properly returning the src property.

Steps to fix the issue:

  1. Make sure renderImage always returns a valid src.

  2. Check if the image URL is available in the BoardCard component.

Here’s an updated version of your code with these checks:

Updated renderImage function:

We’ll ensure the renderImage function always returns a valid image source, and I'll also add better error handling in case the image URL is missing or malformed.

Code Update:

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const advisorRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor"
        );
        const advisorData = await advisorRes.json();
        setAdvisors(advisorData);

        const executiveRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=EB"
        );
        const executiveData = await executiveRes.json();
        setExecutives(executiveData);

        const activeMemberRes = await fetch(
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Active%20Members"
        );
        const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json();
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    // Default image URL in case imageUrl is missing or broken
    const defaultImageUrl = "/img/default-image.jpg";

    // If imageUrl is empty or invalid, return the default image
    if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
      return defaultImageUrl;
    }

    return imageUrl;
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}  {/* Ensure image URL is valid */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {executives.map((executive, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={executive.Name}
              position={executive.Position}
              image={renderImage(executive.Image)}  {/* Ensure image URL is valid */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: executive.Facebook,
                linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                instagram: executive.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>

      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={member.Name}
              position={member.Position}
              image={renderImage(member.Image)}  {/* Ensure image URL is valid */}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: member.Facebook,
                linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                instagram: member.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

What's Changed:

  1. renderImage now checks if the imageUrl is empty, "null", or "undefined". If it's any of these, it will return a default image URL (/img/default-image.jpg).

  2. Fixed the Image URL Rendering:

    • The image property passed to the BoardCard component will now always be a valid image URL or the fallback image.

  3. Fallback Image:

    • You should place a default-image.jpg in your assets folder to handle cases where the actual image URL is broken or missing. This is an example of how it might look:

    arduino
    /public/img/default-image.jpg

Next Steps:

  1. Test the image URLs manually in the browser to ensure they are correct and publicly accessible.

  2. Fallback Image: Add a fallback image at /public/img/default-image.jpg or change it to any other image you want as a fallback.

  3. Console Logs: If it still doesn't work, check your browser console for any specific errors related to the image loading. This will help pinpoint the issue (e.g., CORS issues or broken URLs).

Let me know if the issue persists, and we can troubleshoot further.

You said:
update the bos card code to work import React from 'react'; import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa'; import Image from 'next/image'; const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => { return ( <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4"> <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden"> <div className="card-body p-4"> <div className="text-center"> <div className="mb-3"> <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange"> <Image src={image} height={150} width={150} alt={name} className="rounded-circle" /> </div> </div> <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2> <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5> </div> <div className="text-center"> <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3"> {socialLinks.facebook && ( <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.linkedin && ( <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.instagram && ( <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default BoardCard;
ChatGPT said:

Your BoardCard component is using Next.js’s <Image /> component, which requires either an image from the local public/ directory or domains to be explicitly allowed in next.config.js if the image is hosted externally (via a URL).

✅ Solution

If your images are from external URLs, you should either:

Option 1: Use <img> tag instead of <Image />

This is simpler and works immediately for remote URLs:

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4">
      <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
        <div className="card-body p-4">
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="mb-3">
              <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange">
                <img
                  src={image}
                  height={150}
                  width={150}
                  alt={name}
                  className="rounded-circle"
                  style={{ objectFit: 'cover' }}
                />
              </div>
            </div>
            <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2>
            <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5>
          </div>
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
              {socialLinks.facebook && (
                <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.linkedin && (
                <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.instagram && (
                <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Option 2: Keep using next/image — but allow external domains

If you'd rather stick with Next.js’s <Image /> for optimization, then you must update your next.config.js like this:

js
// next.config.js
module.exports = {
  images: {
    domains: ['example.com', 'anotherdomain.com'], // Replace with the actual domains hosting your images
  },
};

Then restart your dev server with:

bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev

✅ Recommendation

Since you're loading images from Google Sheets data (likely Google Drive, Imgur, or similar), Option 1 (using <img>) is the most straightforward and works instantly.

Let me know if you want to go with optimized images (<Image />) and need help configuring the domains.

You said:
fix the page code "use client"; import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap'; import BoardCard from '../components/board_card'; const About = () => { const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]); const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]); const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { const fetchData = async () => { try { const advisorRes = await fetch( "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=Advisor" );
