const activeMemberData = await activeMemberRes.json(); setActiveMembers(activeMemberData); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching data:", error); } }; fetchData(); }, []); const renderImage = (imageUrl) => { // Default image URL in case imageUrl is missing or broken const defaultImageUrl = "/img/default-image.jpg"; // If imageUrl is empty or invalid, return the default image if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") { return defaultImageUrl; } return imageUrl; }; return ( <> <section className="bg-dark-navy"> <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2> <p className="text-light text-center lead"> Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering. </p> </div> </section> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Advisory Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {advisors.map((advisor, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={advisor.Name} position={advisor.Position} image={renderImage(advisor.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: advisor.Facebook, linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn, instagram: advisor.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Executive Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {executives.map((executive, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={executive.Name} position={executive.Position} image={renderImage(executive.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: executive.Facebook, linkedin: executive.LinkedIn, instagram: executive.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mt-5 mb-6 text-center">Active Members</h1> <Container> <Row> {activeMembers.map((member, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={member.Name} position={member.Position} image={renderImage(member.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: member.Facebook, linkedin: member.LinkedIn, instagram: member.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </> ); }; export default About;
ChatGPT said:

To fix your About page, we need to ensure the images are properly rendered from external URLs, especially since you're using BoardCard, which previously used Next.js's <Image />.

Since you’re now likely using the updated BoardCard with a native <img> tag (based on our previous conversation), here’s a clean and corrected version of your page code:

✅ Final Fixed About Page Code

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`)
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([
          advisorRes.json(),
          executiveRes.json(),
          activeMemberRes.json()
        ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    const defaultImageUrl = "https://via.placeholder.com/150";
    if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
      return defaultImageUrl;
    }
    return imageUrl;
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                image={renderImage(executive.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                image={renderImage(member.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

✅ Ensure BoardCard uses <img>:

Make sure your BoardCard file has this part exactly:

jsx
<img
  src={image}
  height={150}
  width={150}
  alt={name}
  className="rounded-circle"
  style={{ objectFit: 'cover' }}
/>

🧪 Final Tips

  1. Confirm image URLs are valid. Test one manually in the browser.

  2. If from Google Drive, make sure links are public and direct (not the share page).

  3. You can use console.log(advisor.Image) in dev to debug URLs.

Want me to help validate the image URLs you're using or fix Google Drive sharing links?

You said:
make the renderimage func wait unttll the data is fetched from the rest api
ChatGPT said:

The renderImage() function doesn't need to wait for data fetching—because React's render cycle naturally waits for useEffect() to fetch and set the state before attempting to render data-dependent content

You said:
make the renderimage function wait until the rest api data loads "use client"; import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap'; import BoardCard from '../components/board_card'; const About = () => { const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]); const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]); const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { const fetchData = async () => { try { const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet="; const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([ fetch(${baseUrl}Advisor), fetch(${baseUrl}EB), fetch(${baseUrl}Active%20Members) ]); const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([ advisorRes.json(), executiveRes.json(), activeMemberRes.json() ]); setAdvisors(advisorData); setExecutives(executiveData); setActiveMembers(activeMemberData); } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching data:", error); } }; fetchData(); }, []); const renderImage = (imageUrl) => { const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"; if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") { return defaultImageUrl; } return imageUrl; }; return ( <> <section className="bg-dark-navy"> <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2> <p className="text-light text-center lead"> Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering. </p> </div> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {advisors.map((advisor, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={advisor.Name} position={advisor.Position} image={renderImage(advisor.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: advisor.Facebook, linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn, instagram: advisor.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {executives.map((executive, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={executive.Name} position={executive.Position} image={renderImage(executive.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: executive.Facebook, linkedin: executive.LinkedIn, instagram: executive.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1> <Container> <Row> {activeMembers.map((member, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={member.Name} position={member.Position} image={renderImage(member.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: member.Facebook, linkedin: member.LinkedIn, instagram: member.Instagram }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> </> ); }; export default About;
ChatGPT said:

To make sure your component doesn't attempt to render before the API data (and image URLs) have loaded, you don't need to "wait" in renderImage(). Instead, you should conditionally render the sections only after data is fetched.

Here’s how to improve your code safely:

✅ Add a loading state

Update your useState hooks to track loading status:

js
const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);

Update fetchData to set loading when done:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const fetchData = async () => {
    try {
      const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

      const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
        fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
        fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
        fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`)
      ]);

      const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([
        advisorRes.json(),
        executiveRes.json(),
        activeMemberRes.json()
      ]);

      setAdvisors(advisorData);
      setExecutives(executiveData);
      setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  fetchData();
}, []);

✅ Conditionally render content

Wrap your sections like this:

jsx
{!loading && (
  <>
    <section className="my-5">
      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
      <Container>
        <Row>
          {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
            <BoardCard
              key={index}
              name={advisor.Name}
              position={advisor.Position}
              image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}
              socialLinks={{
                facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                instagram: advisor.Instagram
              }}
            />
          ))}
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </section>

    {/* Repeat the same for Executive Board and Active Members */}
  </>
)}

Optionally, add a simple loading UI before data appears:

jsx
{loading && (
  <div className="text-center py-5">
    <p>Loading team information...</p>
  </div>
)}

This ensures renderImage() won’t even be called until all data is ready.

Would you like me to give you the full updated code block?

You said:
give me whole code for the page.jsx
ChatGPT said:

Here is the fully updated page.jsx (or About.jsx) file, with loading state handling and conditional rendering to ensure images are not processed before the API data is fetched:

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`)
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([
          advisorRes.json(),
          executiveRes.json(),
          activeMemberRes.json()
        ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      } finally {
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";
    if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
      return defaultImageUrl;
    }
    return imageUrl;
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      {loading ? (
        <div className="text-center py-5">
          <p className="text-lg font-semibold">Loading team information...</p>
        </div>
      ) : (
        <>
          <section className="my-5">
            <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
            <Container>
              <Row>
                {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
                  <BoardCard
                    key={index}
                    name={advisor.Name}
                    position={advisor.Position}
                    image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}
                    socialLinks={{
                      facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                      linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                      instagram: advisor.Instagram
                    }}
                  />
                ))}
              </Row>
            </Container>
          </section>

          <section className="my-5">
            <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
            <Container>
              <Row>
                {executives.map((executive, index) => (
                  <BoardCard
                    key={index}
                    name={executive.Name}
                    position={executive.Position}
                    image={renderImage(executive.Image)}
                    socialLinks={{
                      facebook: executive.Facebook,
                      linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                      instagram: executive.Instagram
                    }}
                  />
                ))}
              </Row>
            </Container>
          </section>

          <section className="my-5">
            <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
            <Container>
              <Row>
                {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
                  <BoardCard
                    key={index}
                    name={member.Name}
                    position={member.Position}
                    image={renderImage(member.Image)}
                    socialLinks={{
                      facebook: member.Facebook,
                      linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                      instagram: member.Instagram
                    }}
                  />
                ))}
              </Row>
            </Container>
          </section>
        </>
      )}
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

This version:

  • Prevents rendering before the API data is available.

  • Handles broken/missing image URLs.

  • Shows a loading message until everything is ready.

Let me know if you want to add a spinner or animation to the loading state!

You said:
all showing the default image despite having image urls
ChatGPT said:

Thanks for the update. If all cards are still showing the default image, even though the image URLs exist, the issue likely lies in how Next.js's Image component handles external URLs.

By default, Next.js only allows loading images from domains that are explicitly allowed in the next.config.js file. Here's how to fix it:

✅ Step 1: Update next.config.js

Add your image domains (e.g. drive.google.com, i.imgur.com, etc.) to the config:

js
// next.config.js
module.exports = {
  images: {
    domains: ['i.imgur.com', 'drive.google.com', 'yourdomain.com'], // Add all necessary domains here
  },
};

⚠️ If the image URLs are from Google Drive, make sure they are direct links ending in .jpg, .png, etc. (not share links).

Then restart your dev server:

bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev

✅ Step 2: Confirm image URLs are valid

Update your renderImage() function to log image URLs:

js
const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";
  console.log("Rendering image:", imageUrl);
  if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
    return defaultImageUrl;
  }
  return imageUrl;
};

This will confirm that valid URLs are actually passed in.

✅ Step 3: (Optional) Temporarily use <img> instead of next/image for testing

If needed, try replacing this inside your BoardCard:

jsx
<Image
  src={image}
  height={150}
  width={150}
  alt={name}
  className="rounded-circle"
/>

with:

jsx
<img
  src={image}
  height={150}
  width={150}
  alt={name}
  className="rounded-circle"
/>

If this works, then the issue is definitely with next/image restrictions.

Would you like help modifying the BoardCard component to optionally fall back to <img> when external images fail with next/image?

You said:
thats not the issue the issue is with renderImage func make that wait
ChatGPT said:

Thanks for the clarification. The issue is not with next/image or external domains — you’re saying the renderImage() function is being called before the image URLs are populated.

But React's rendering is declarative and synchronous — you can’t make renderImage() wait, but you can prevent rendering of components until the data is ready.

✅ Solution: Wait until data is loaded before rendering

We’ll use a loading state to block rendering until all API calls are done.

✅ Updated page.jsx (Complete and Corrected)

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap";
import BoardCard from "../components/board_card";

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // ✅ new

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl =
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
          await Promise.all([
            advisorRes.json(),
            executiveRes.json(),
            activeMemberRes.json(),
          ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
        setLoading(false); // ✅ set loading to false when done
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";
    if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
      return defaultImageUrl;
    }
    return imageUrl;
  };

  if (loading) {
    return (
      <div className="text-center py-5">
        <h2>Loading...</h2>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of
            Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                image={renderImage(executive.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                image={renderImage(member.Image)}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

✅ What changed?

  • Added loading state to prevent rendering until all data is fetched.

  • Now renderImage() is only called after data is present — fixing the issue.

Let me know if you want to show a loading spinner or fallback UI during loading.

You said:
this is wrong const renderImage = (imageUrl) => { const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"; if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") { return defaultImageUrl; } return imageUrl; };
ChatGPT said:

You're absolutely right to question this — that function is not properly handling what it claims to. Specifically:

js
if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined")

  • "null" and "undefined" are strings, not actual null or undefined values.

  • The check fails if the API sends an empty string, whitespace, or other falsy values.

✅ Correct renderImage() Function

js
const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

  if (
    !imageUrl ||                         // null, undefined, empty
    typeof imageUrl !== "string" ||
    imageUrl.trim() === "" ||            // whitespace only
    imageUrl.trim().toLowerCase() === "null" ||
    imageUrl.trim().toLowerCase() === "undefined"
  ) {
    return defaultImageUrl;
  }

  return imageUrl.trim(); // ensure clean string
};

Why this works:

  • It checks for null, undefined, empty string, and stringified "null"/"undefined" — which are common edge cases from Google Sheets or bad APIs.

  • It trims the result to avoid issues from extra spaces.

This should now behave exactly how you'd expect. Want me to also validate image URLs using regex or a HEAD check?

You said:
for some reason the image from the api are not showing
ChatGPT said:

If your image URLs from the API are not showing, even though they're valid, there are a few common causes. Let's break it down and troubleshoot:

✅ 1. You're using next/image — it blocks external domains by default

Next.js requires you to explicitly allow remote image domains in next.config.js.

🔧 Fix:

Open your next.config.js and add the external domain(s):

js
// next.config.js
module.exports = {
  images: {
    domains: ['your-image-host.com', 'drive.google.com', 'imgur.com'], // add all domains used
  },
};

Then restart the dev server:

bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev

✅ 2. Double-check the actual image URLs in the API

Use console.log(member.Image) or console.table(activeMembers) after fetching to verify the structure.

If the API gives Google Drive links or ones that aren't direct image URLs, they'll fail to load in <img> or next/image.

🔧 Fix for Google Drive:

Transform shared URLs to direct image links. Example:

js
// From: https://drive.google.com/file/d/FILE_ID/view?usp=sharing
// To:   https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=FILE_ID

You can use this helper:

js
const parseGoogleDriveUrl = (url) => {
  const match = url.match(/\/d\/(.*?)\//);
  return match ? `https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=${match[1]}` : url;
};

✅ 3. If unsure — fall back to regular <img>

You can temporarily test with standard HTML to confirm if next/image is the issue:

jsx
<img
  src={member.Image}
  alt={member.Name}
  width="150"
  height="150"
  style={{ borderRadius: "50%" }}
/>

If this works but next/image doesn't, the problem is definitely domain restriction or image layout issues.

Would you like me to update the BoardCard component to use <img> instead of next/image as a fallback test?

You said:
the page is still showing default image event when there is a image url. check and fix
ChatGPT said:

Let's troubleshoot the issue systematically to ensure that the image URLs are processed correctly.

Here's a detailed debugging process:

  1. Verify the Image URLs: Let's log the image URLs in the renderImage function to make sure you're actually getting the correct data from the API. This will confirm that you're not working with a broken or undefined URL.

  2. Check for API Errors: Log the data received from the API and check if the image URLs are valid.

  3. Ensure the URLs are formatted correctly: For example, if you're using Google Drive or a similar service, ensure that the image URLs are direct links.

Updated Code

Here’s an updated version of your component where we add debugging logs to help identify the problem.

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { Container, Row } from 'react-bootstrap';
import BoardCard from '../components/board_card';

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`)
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([
          advisorRes.json(),
          executiveRes.json(),
          activeMemberRes.json()
        ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
    console.log("Rendering image with URL:", imageUrl); // Log the image URL here
    const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

    // Check if the image URL is valid
    if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") {
      console.log("Using default image"); // Log to check fallback
      return defaultImageUrl;
    }
    return imageUrl;
  };

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                image={renderImage(advisor.Image)} // Here the image URL will be logged
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                image={renderImage(executive.Image)} // Same here
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                image={renderImage(member.Image)} // Same here
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Steps:

  1. Check Logs: The renderImage function now logs the imageUrl. Check the browser console for the actual value of imageUrl. If you see the correct URLs being passed, then it’s something else.

  2. Check the Image URLs: Make sure that the URLs returned from the API are valid image links. If they aren't, like if they're Google Drive links, you’ll need to convert them to direct image URLs.

  3. Confirm the Default Image URL: If you’re still seeing the default image, verify that imageUrl is valid and that it’s not empty or incorrectly parsed.

After checking the console logs, let me know if the URLs seem valid and if there's still any issue with the image not loading.

You said:
remove the renderImage func "use client"; import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap"; import BoardCard from "../components/board_card"; const About = () => { const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]); const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]); const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // ✅ new useEffect(() => { const fetchData = async () => { try { const baseUrl = "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet="; const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([ fetch(${baseUrl}Advisor), fetch(${baseUrl}EB), fetch(${baseUrl}Active%20Members), ]); const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] = await Promise.all([ advisorRes.json(), executiveRes.json(), activeMemberRes.json(), ]); setAdvisors(advisorData); setExecutives(executiveData); setActiveMembers(activeMemberData); setLoading(false); // ✅ set loading to false when done } catch (error) { console.error("Error fetching data:", error); setLoading(false); } }; fetchData(); }, []); const renderImage = (imageUrl) => { const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"; if (!imageUrl || imageUrl === "null" || imageUrl === "undefined") { return defaultImageUrl; } return imageUrl; }; if (loading) { return ( <div className="text-center py-5"> <h2>Loading...</h2> </div> ); } return ( <> <section className="bg-dark-navy"> <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5"> <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2> <p className="text-light text-center lead"> Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of Computer Science and Engineering. </p> </div> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {advisors.map((advisor, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={advisor.Name} position={advisor.Position} image={renderImage(advisor.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: advisor.Facebook, linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn, instagram: advisor.Instagram, }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1> <Container> <Row> {executives.map((executive, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={executive.Name} position={executive.Position} image={renderImage(executive.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: executive.Facebook, linkedin: executive.LinkedIn, instagram: executive.Instagram, }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> <section className="my-5"> <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1> <Container> <Row> {activeMembers.map((member, index) => ( <BoardCard key={index} name={member.Name} position={member.Position} image={renderImage(member.Image)} socialLinks={{ facebook: member.Facebook, linkedin: member.LinkedIn, instagram: member.Instagram, }} /> ))} </Row> </Container> </section> </> ); }; export default About;
ChatGPT said:

You want to remove the renderImage function, so we will just directly use the image URL from the API without any extra logic. I'll also ensure that if the image URL is invalid or missing, the default image will be used directly in the image prop.

Here’s the updated code with the renderImage function removed:

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap";
import BoardCard from "../components/board_card";

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // ✅ new

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl =
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
          await Promise.all([
            advisorRes.json(),
            executiveRes.json(),
            activeMemberRes.json(),
          ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
        setLoading(false); // ✅ set loading to false when done
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  if (loading) {
    return (
      <div className="text-center py-5">
        <h2>Loading...</h2>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of
            Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                // Directly using image URL here, if missing use the default image URL
                image={advisor.Image ? advisor.Image : "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                // Same here for image
                image={executive.Image ? executive.Image : "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                // Same here for image
                image={member.Image ? member.Image : "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Changes:

  1. Removed the renderImage function: Instead of using the renderImage function, I directly check if the image URL exists for each individual member (advisor, executive, active member). If it doesn't exist, the default image URL ("https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg") is used.

  2. Inline fallback logic: For each BoardCard component, I added the conditional logic directly in the image prop to use the default image if the actual image URL is invalid or missing.

Testing:

  • Check if the images are correctly showing now (using the actual URLs from the API or the default image if missing).

  • If the issue persists, ensure that the image URLs in the API are correct and not malformed.

Let me know if this resolves the issue or if you need further assistance!

You said:
the syntax is wrong
ChatGPT said:

I apologize for the confusion. Here's the corrected code with proper syntax. The issue was in the inline image check, so I'll ensure the conditional logic is applied correctly in JSX.

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap";
import BoardCard from "../components/board_card";

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // ✅ new

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl =
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
          await Promise.all([
            advisorRes.json(),
            executiveRes.json(),
            activeMemberRes.json(),
          ]);

        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
        setLoading(false); // ✅ set loading to false when done
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  if (loading) {
    return (
      <div className="text-center py-5">
        <h2>Loading...</h2>
      </div>
    );
  }

  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of
            Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                // Check if the image URL exists; use default if not
                image={advisor.Image ? advisor.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                // Same for image
                image={executive.Image ? executive.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                // Same for image
                image={member.Image ? member.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Changes:

  • I moved the defaultImageUrl out of the component so it's more readable.

  • Used the correct syntax to check if an image exists. If not, the default image will be used directly.

Key Points:

  • The image prop in the BoardCard component will now either get the actual image URL from the API or use the default image if no image URL is available.

  • If you still see the default image despite having a valid image URL, please ensure that the URLs in your API are correct and accessible.

Let me know if this works as expected!

You said:
the image from api for some reasons seems to be null,
ChatGPT said:

If the image URLs from the API are null, there could be a few reasons why that’s happening. Here’s a checklist of things to verify and how we can handle them:

Things to check:

  1. Check API Data: Inspect the raw API response to ensure that the Image field is actually being sent. You can log the response in the useEffect hook to check if the image URLs are correct.

    Example:

    js
    useEffect(() => {
  const fetchData = async () => {
    try {
      const baseUrl =
        "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

      const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
        fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
        fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
        fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
      ]);

      const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
        await Promise.all([
          advisorRes.json(),
          executiveRes.json(),
          activeMemberRes.json(),
        ]);

      console.log(advisorData); // Check API response
      setAdvisors(advisorData);
      setExecutives(executiveData);
      setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
      setLoading(false);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
      setLoading(false);
    }
  };

  fetchData();
}, []);

    This will help you see if the Image field is coming through as expected.

  2. Check for Missing or Empty Image URLs: Sometimes, an image might not be present, and it may return null or an empty string. You can handle that by checking whether the Image field exists or not.

Solution:

If you want to handle cases where the image URL is null, you can modify your image handling logic as follows:

  1. Log API Data: Add a console.log to check what you are getting from the API.

  2. Handle Missing Image URL Gracefully: Add fallback logic for null or empty values.

Here’s how you can handle it:

jsx
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap";
import BoardCard from "../components/board_card";

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl =
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
          await Promise.all([
            advisorRes.json(),
            executiveRes.json(),
            activeMemberRes.json(),
          ]);

        console.log(advisorData); // Log the raw data to check image field
        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
        setLoading(false);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

  if (loading) {
    return (
      <div className="text-center py-5">
        <h2>Loading...</h2>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of
            Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                // If image is null or empty, use default
                image={advisor.Image && advisor.Image.trim() !== "" ? advisor.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                // Same check for image
                image={executive.Image && executive.Image.trim() !== "" ? executive.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                // Same check for image
                image={member.Image && member.Image.trim() !== "" ? member.Image : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Explanation of Changes:

  1. Check if the Image URL is Valid:

    • The condition advisor.Image && advisor.Image.trim() !== "" ensures that the image URL is not null, undefined, or an empty string. If the image URL is invalid, it falls back to the defaultImageUrl.

  2. Logging API Data: The console.log(advisorData) will help you check what data is coming from the API. Look at the structure of the response and ensure that the Image field is correctly named and has valid values.

This should handle cases where the image URL is empty or missing and provide the default image as a fallback. Let me know if this works for you or if you still see issues.

You said:
google drive image not working
ChatGPT said:

If you're using Google Drive images and they're not showing up correctly, it's likely because Google Drive links are not directly accessible as image URLs. Google Drive generates shareable links, but these links are not in a direct image format that can be used in HTML img tags. To solve this, you need to modify the Google Drive link to be publicly accessible.

Steps to make Google Drive images work:

  1. Make the Image Public:

    • Open the file in Google Drive.

    • Right-click the image file and select Get link.

    • Under the sharing settings, make sure the file is set to Anyone with the link and has Viewer access.

  2. Get the Correct Image URL:
    The link you get from Google Drive will look something like this:

    bash
    https://drive.google.com/file/d/FILE_ID/view?usp=sharing

    To turn this into a direct image URL, you need to format the link like this:

    bash
    https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=FILE_ID

    Replace FILE_ID with the actual file ID from the original shareable link.

Example:

If your Google Drive shareable link is:

bash
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J/view?usp=sharing

You would convert it to:

bash
https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J

Update Your Code:

When fetching the image from the API, make sure to transform the Google Drive link as shown above before using it in your BoardCard component.

Here’s how you can modify the code to handle Google Drive links:

js
const renderImage = (imageUrl) => {
  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";
  
  // Check if the URL is a Google Drive link and transform it
  if (imageUrl && imageUrl.includes('drive.google.com')) {
    const fileIdMatch = imageUrl.match(/\/d\/([^\/]+)/);
    if (fileIdMatch && fileIdMatch[1]) {
      const googleDriveImageUrl = `https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=${fileIdMatch[1]}`;
      return googleDriveImageUrl;
    }
  }

  // If not a Google Drive link or invalid, return default image
  return imageUrl || defaultImageUrl;
};

Full Code with the renderImage Function Removed:

Here’s the updated version of your component with the renderImage function fixed to handle Google Drive links:

js
"use client";
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { Container, Row } from "react-bootstrap";
import BoardCard from "../components/board_card";

const About = () => {
  const [advisors, setAdvisors] = useState([]);
  const [executives, setExecutives] = useState([]);
  const [activeMembers, setActiveMembers] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      try {
        const baseUrl =
          "https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxGit2TPiyIEeehlpd5zsp6fdLO0QbKEssjO8FtzIc9IuQecCx1JSXvnNS8yim8ALgjsQ/exec?sheet=";

        const [advisorRes, executiveRes, activeMemberRes] = await Promise.all([
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Advisor`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}EB`),
          fetch(`${baseUrl}Active%20Members`),
        ]);

        const [advisorData, executiveData, activeMemberData] =
          await Promise.all([
            advisorRes.json(),
            executiveRes.json(),
            activeMemberRes.json(),
          ]);

        console.log(advisorData); // Log the raw data to check image field
        setAdvisors(advisorData);
        setExecutives(executiveData);
        setActiveMembers(activeMemberData);
        setLoading(false);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Error fetching data:", error);
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };

    fetchData();
  }, []);

  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

  if (loading) {
    return (
      <div className="text-center py-5">
        <h2>Loading...</h2>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <>
      <section className="bg-dark-navy">
        <div className="container d-flex flex-column justify-content-center align-items-center py-5">
          <h2 className="display-1 text-light">ABOUT US</h2>
          <p className="text-light text-center lead">
            Empowering Minds, Igniting Innovations - Unleashing the Potential of
            Computer Science and Engineering.
          </p>
        </div>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Advisory Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {advisors.map((advisor, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={advisor.Name}
                position={advisor.Position}
                // If image is null or empty, use default
                image={advisor.Image && advisor.Image.trim() !== "" ? renderImage(advisor.Image) : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: advisor.Facebook,
                  linkedin: advisor.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: advisor.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Executive Board</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {executives.map((executive, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={executive.Name}
                position={executive.Position}
                // Same check for image
                image={executive.Image && executive.Image.trim() !== "" ? renderImage(executive.Image) : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: executive.Facebook,
                  linkedin: executive.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: executive.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>

      <section className="my-5">
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-center">Active Members</h1>
        <Container>
          <Row>
            {activeMembers.map((member, index) => (
              <BoardCard
                key={index}
                name={member.Name}
                position={member.Position}
                // Same check for image
                image={member.Image && member.Image.trim() !== "" ? renderImage(member.Image) : defaultImageUrl}
                socialLinks={{
                  facebook: member.Facebook,
                  linkedin: member.LinkedIn,
                  instagram: member.Instagram,
                }}
              />
            ))}
          </Row>
        </Container>
      </section>
    </>
  );
};

export default About;

Key Changes:

  1. The renderImage function checks if the image URL is a Google Drive link and modifies it accordingly to create a direct link.

  2. It replaces any null or empty image URL with the default image URL.

Now, Google Drive images should work correctly in your app. Let me know if you encounter any further issues!

You said:
make a function for image render , make it check if the url is drive link, if to then change the url, as example drive link https://drive.google.com/file/d/10fyiwmiG3i1iBy2reZ0LmmqMm6nuNzeB/view, change to https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/d/10fyiwmiG3i1iBy2reZ0LmmqMm6nuNzeB
ChatGPT said:

Here’s a reusable renderImage function that handles the conversion of Google Drive links to direct image links using the format you specified (https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/d/FILE_ID), and falls back to a default image if the URL is invalid or empty:

js
const renderImage = (url) => {
  const defaultImageUrl = "https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg";

  if (!url || url.trim() === "" || url === "null" || url === "undefined") {
    return defaultImageUrl;
  }

  // Check for Google Drive file link and convert
  const driveMatch = url.match(/drive\.google\.com\/file\/d\/([a-zA-Z0-9_-]+)/);
  if (driveMatch && driveMatch[1]) {
    const fileId = driveMatch[1];
    return `https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/d/${fileId}`;
  }

  // Return original URL if not a Drive link
  return url;
};

Example Usage:

Replace:

js
image={advisor.Image && advisor.Image.trim() !== "" ? renderImage(advisor.Image) : defaultImageUrl}

With simply:

js
image={renderImage(advisor.Image)}

Summary:

  • ✅ Converts Google Drive links into usable direct links.

  • ✅ Defaults to your fallback image if the link is empty or invalid.

  • ✅ Safe and easy to reuse throughout your code.

Want me to integrate this function into your full About page code?

You said:
can i get only a single row data from the appscript url?
ChatGPT said:

Yes, you can fetch a single row of data from a Google Apps Script web app URL, but it depends on how your script is written. By default, your Apps Script might return the entire sheet, but you can modify it to return a single row based on a query parameter, like an ID or index.

✅ Example: Modify your Apps Script to return a single row

Here's how to update your doGet function in Apps Script to return a row by index or a unique field (like name or ID):

🔧 Sample Apps Script:

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  const sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  const rowId = e.parameter.id; // optional param for single row
  
  const ss = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet();
  const sheet = ss.getSheetByName(sheetName);
  const data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  const headers = data[0];
  const rows = data.slice(1);

  // If `id` parameter is present, return only the matching row
  if (rowId !== undefined) {
    const result = rows.find(row => row[0].toString() === rowId.toString()); // Match by first column (you can change index)
    if (result) {
      const obj = headers.reduce((acc, key, i) => {
        acc[key] = result[i];
        return acc;
      }, {});
      return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(obj)).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
    } else {
      return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify({ error: "Row not found" })).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
    }
  }

  // Default: return all rows
  const formatted = rows.map(row => {
    return headers.reduce((acc, key, i) => {
      acc[key] = row[i];
      return acc;
    }, {});
  });

  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(formatted)).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

🔍 Example URL Usage:

Fetch all:

bash
https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXXXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor

Fetch a single row by ID:

bash
https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXXXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor&id=1

Replace id=1 with the matching first column value (like student ID or name).

Would you like help modifying your existing Apps Script to do this?

You said:
also add row id to the fetch all
ChatGPT said:

To add rowId to each object in the "fetch all" response and also support fetching a single row by that rowId, here's a complete updated version of your doGet() function in Google Apps Script:

✅ Full doGet Function:

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  const sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  const targetRowId = e.parameter.id;

  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify({ error: "Missing sheet parameter" }))
      .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
  }

  const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify({ error: "Sheet not found" }))
      .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
  }

  const data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();
  const headers = data[0];
  const rows = data.slice(1);

  // Format rows with rowId
  const formatted = rows.map((row, index) => {
    const obj = headers.reduce((acc, key, i) => {
      acc[key] = row[i];
      return acc;
    }, {});
    obj.rowId = index + 2; // +2 accounts for 0-indexing and headers
    return obj;
  });

  // Return one row if `id` (rowId) is passed
  if (targetRowId) {
    const row = formatted.find(item => item.rowId == targetRowId);
    if (row) {
      return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(row))
        .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
    } else {
      return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify({ error: "Row not found" }))
        .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
    }
  }

  // Return all if no id is given
  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(formatted))
    .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

🔍 Example Usage:

  • Fetch All Rows with rowId included:

    bash
    https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor

  • Fetch a Single Row by rowId (e.g., row 4 in the sheet):

    bash
    https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor&id=4

Let me know if you want to filter rows using a unique key like Name or Email instead of row number.

You said:
not like this use this code and update to mimic this code just add the id function doGet(e) { var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet; if (!sheetName) { return ContentService.createTextOutput("Please provide a 'sheet' parameter in the URL.") .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT); } var spreadsheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet(); var sheet = spreadsheet.getSheetByName(sheetName); if (!sheet) { return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet named '" + sheetName + "' not found.") .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT); } var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues(); // Use second row as headers (index 1) var headers = data[1]; // Second row var rows = []; // Start from third row (index 2) to get actual data for (var i = 2; i < data.length; i++) { var rowObject = {}; for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) { rowObject[headers[j]] = data[i][j]; } rows.push(rowObject); } return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(rows)) .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON); }
ChatGPT said:

Thanks! Based on your provided code, here's the updated version that adds id to each row (based on its actual row number in the sheet) and also supports fetching a single row by id using a query like ?sheet=Advisor&id=5.

✅ Updated doGet Function:

javascript
function doGet(e) {
  var sheetName = e.parameter.sheet;
  var targetId = e.parameter.id;

  if (!sheetName) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Please provide a 'sheet' parameter in the URL.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var spreadsheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet();
  var sheet = spreadsheet.getSheetByName(sheetName);
  
  if (!sheet) {
    return ContentService.createTextOutput("Sheet named '" + sheetName + "' not found.")
                         .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
  }

  var data = sheet.getDataRange().getValues();

  // Use second row as headers (index 1)
  var headers = data[1];
  var rows = [];

  // Start from third row (index 2) to get actual data
  for (var i = 2; i < data.length; i++) {
    var rowObject = {};
    for (var j = 0; j < headers.length; j++) {
      rowObject[headers[j]] = data[i][j];
    }
    rowObject.id = i + 1; // Spreadsheet row index (1-based)
    rows.push(rowObject);
  }

  // If an id is provided, return only that row
  if (targetId) {
    var filtered = rows.find(r => r.id == targetId);
    if (filtered) {
      return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(filtered))
                           .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
    } else {
      return ContentService.createTextOutput("Row with id " + targetId + " not found.")
                           .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.TEXT);
    }
  }

  // Return all rows if no id is provided
  return ContentService.createTextOutput(JSON.stringify(rows))
                       .setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
}

🔍 Example Usage:

  • All data:

    bash
    https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor

  • Specific row by id (e.g., row 5 in sheet):

    bash
    https://script.google.com/macros/s/XXXX/exec?sheet=Advisor&id=5

Let me know if you also want to support filtering by a specific column (like Name or Email).

You said:
make name and Position capitalise import React from 'react'; import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa'; const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => { return ( <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4"> <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden"> <div className="card-body p-4"> <div className="text-center"> <div className="mb-3"> <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange"> <img src={image} height={150} width={150} alt={name} className="rounded-circle" style={{ objectFit: 'cover' }} /> </div> </div> <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{name}</h2> <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{position}</h5> </div> <div className="text-center"> <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3"> {socialLinks.facebook && ( <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.linkedin && ( <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} {socialLinks.instagram && ( <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} /> </a> )} </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default BoardCard;
ChatGPT said:

To capitalize the name and position in your BoardCard component, you can create a small helper function to capitalize each word. Here's your updated component:

✅ Updated BoardCard.jsx:

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { FaFacebook, FaLinkedin, FaInstagram } from 'react-icons/fa';

// Capitalize each word in a string
const capitalizeWords = (str) => {
  return str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(' ')
        .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
        .join(' ')
    : '';
};

const BoardCard = ({ name, position, image, socialLinks }) => {
  return (
    <div className="col-lg-4 mb-4">
      <div className="card border-0 shadow-lg rounded-lg overflow-hidden">
        <div className="card-body p-4">
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="mb-3">
              <div className="d-inline-block rounded-circle border border-5 border-orange">
                <img
                  src={image}
                  height={150}
                  width={150}
                  alt={name}
                  className="rounded-circle"
                  style={{ objectFit: 'cover' }}
                />
              </div>
            </div>
            <h2 className="fs-4 font-weight-bold text-dark">{capitalizeWords(name)}</h2>
            <h5 className="fs-6 text-muted mb-3">{capitalizeWords(position)}</h5>
          </div>
          <div className="text-center">
            <div className="icons d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
              {socialLinks.facebook && (
                <a href={socialLinks.facebook} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaFacebook size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.linkedin && (
                <a href={socialLinks.linkedin} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaLinkedin size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
              {socialLinks.instagram && (
                <a href={socialLinks.instagram} className="m-1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                  <FaInstagram size={30} style={{ color: "#f97924" }} />
                </a>
              )}
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BoardCard;

Now both name and position will be properly capitalized regardless of the format returned by the API.

Would you like this formatting applied on the About page as well in case you reuse the name elsewhere?

ChatGPT said:

Here's an improved version of your EventCard component — it enhances layout consistency, accessibility, and design details while using className instead of class, and capitalizes input values cleanly:

✅ Final Updated EventCard.jsx:

jsx
import React from 'react';

// Capitalize each word in a string
const capitalizeWords = (str) => {
  return str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(' ')
        .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
        .join(' ')
    : '';
};

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, location, image, id }) => {
  return (
    <div className="card bg-base-100 w-full md:w-96 shadow-xl mb-6 border border-gray-200 hover:shadow-2xl transition-shadow duration-300">
      <figure className="overflow-hidden max-h-60">
        <img
          src={image}
          alt={name}
          className="w-full object-cover h-60"
        />
      </figure>
      <div className="card-body px-5 py-4">
        <h2 className="card-title text-2xl font-bold text-gray-800 mb-2">
          {capitalizeWords(name)}
          {type && (
            <div className="badge badge-secondary ml-2 text-sm px-2 py-1">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </div>
          )}
        </h2>
        <p className="text-base text-gray-700 mb-1">
          <span className="font-semibold">Date:</span> {capitalizeWords(date)}
        </p>
        <p className="text-base text-gray-700 mb-1">
          <span className="font-semibold">Venue:</span> {capitalizeWords(location)}
        </p>
        <p className="text-base text-gray-700 mb-1">
          <span className="font-semibold">Time:</span> 12:00 PM
        </p>
        <div className="card-actions justify-start mt-4">
          <button className="btn btn-primary w-full">Details</button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

✅ Improvements:

  • Replaced class with className (JSX standard).

  • Added hover shadow effect for interactivity.

  • Set consistent image height with object-cover.

  • Added semantic <span className="font-semibold"> for clarity.

  • Improved spacing and readability.

Do you want the "Details" button to link to a specific route like /events/{id} or open a modal?

You said:

ChatGPT said:

Here's your improved and visually compact EventCard with the requested enhancements:

✅ Features:

  • 📐 Smaller card size with 2:3 image aspect ratio.

  • 🎨 Orange badge and button (btn-orange).

  • ✍️ Cleaner text layout with relevant icons.

  • 💡 All buttons and badges styled consistently with Tailwind/DaisyUI.

✅ Final Updated EventCard.jsx:

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

// Capitalize each word in a string
const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, location, image, id }) => {
  return (
    <div className="card bg-base-100 w-full max-w-xs shadow-md mb-4 border border-gray-200 hover:shadow-xl transition-shadow duration-300">
      <figure className="overflow-hidden" style={{ aspectRatio: "2/3" }}>
        <img src={image} alt={name} className="w-full h-full object-cover" />
      </figure>
      <div className="card-body px-4 py-3">
        <h2 className="card-title text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800 mb-2">
          {capitalizeWords(name)}
          {type && (
            <div className="badge bg-orange-500 text-white ml-2 text-xs font-medium px-2 py-1">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </div>
          )}
        </h2>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-700 space-y-1">
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" /> {capitalizeWords(date)}
          </p>
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaClock className="text-orange-500" /> 12:00 PM
          </p>
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" /> {capitalizeWords(location)}
          </p>
        </div>

        <div className="card-actions mt-4">
          <button className="btn w-full bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-600 text-white border-0">
            Details
          </button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

  • Add RSVP or club-specific badges.

Here's your updated EventCard with the following changes:
