✅ Final Code

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

// Capitalize each word in a string
const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, location, image, id }) => {
  return (
    <div className="card bg-base-100 w-full max-w-[400px] shadow-md mb-4 border border-gray-200 hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow duration-300">
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        className="w-full object-cover"
        style={{ aspectRatio: "3/2" }}
      />

      <div className="card-body px-4 py-3">
        <h2 className="card-title text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800 mb-2">
          {capitalizeWords(name)}
          {type && (
            <div className="badge bg-orange-500 text-white ml-2 text-xs font-medium px-2 py-1">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </div>
          )}
        </h2>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-700 space-y-1">
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" /> {capitalizeWords(date)}
          </p>
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaClock className="text-orange-500" /> 12:00 PM
          </p>
          <p className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" /> {capitalizeWords(location)}
          </p>
        </div>

        <div className="card-actions mt-4">
          <button className="btn w-full bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-600 text-white border-0">
            Details
          </button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

ChatGPT said:

Thanks for the clarification. Here's a refined version of your EventCard with all your requests addressed:

✅ Fixes Included:

  • 🟠 Card width constrained to max 400px

  • 🟠 Better spacing between text elements

  • 🟠 Smaller, visible "Details" button (orange, full width)

  • 🟠 Compact layout and cleaner visuals

✅ Final Updated EventCard:

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

// Capitalize each word in a string
const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((word) => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, location, image, id }) => {
  return (
    <div className="bg-base-100 w-full max-w-[400px] rounded-lg shadow-md border border-gray-200 overflow-hidden">
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        className="w-full object-cover"
        style={{ aspectRatio: "3 / 2" }}
      />

      <div className="p-4">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-2">
          <h2 className="text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800">
            {capitalizeWords(name)}
          </h2>
          {type && (
            <span className="bg-orange-500 text-white text-xs px-2 py-1 rounded">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-700 space-y-1">
          <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" />
            <span>{capitalizeWords(date)}</span>
          </div>
          <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaClock className="text-orange-500" />
            <span>12:00 PM</span>
          </div>
          <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
            <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" />
            <span>{capitalizeWords(location)}</span>
          </div>
        </div>

        <button className="btn w-full bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-600 text-white mt-4 text-sm font-medium">
          Details
        </button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

Let me know if you want the card to be fully responsive for mobile or if you’d like to link the “Details” button to a dynamic route.

You said:
combine with this code import React from 'react'; // Define the types for the props interface EventSlideProps { imgSrc: string; title: string; details: string[]; link: string; } const EventSlide: React.FC<EventSlideProps> = ({ imgSrc, title, details, link }) => { // Function to get the first 10 words from the details array const getFirstTenWords = () => { const allWords = details.join(" ").split(" "); return allWords.slice(0, 10).join(" ") + (allWords.length > 10 ? "..." : ""); }; return ( <div className="p-3 w-100" style={{ backgroundColor: "white", borderRadius: "15px", // Rounded corners overflow: "hidden", // Prevent content from overflowing boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)", // Soft shadow for professional look transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out", // Smooth hover effect }} > <img src={imgSrc} alt={title} className="img-fluid" style={{ width: "100%", height: "auto", objectFit: "cover", borderTopLeftRadius: "15px", borderTopRightRadius: "15px" }} /> <div className="down-content px-3 pt-3 pb-2"> <h4 className="h5 mb-2" style={{ fontSize: "clamp(1rem, 2vw, 1.5rem)" }}>{title}</h4> <p className="text-muted" style={{ fontSize: "clamp(0.8rem, 1.5vw, 1rem)", marginBottom: "0.5rem" }}> {getFirstTenWords()} </p> <div className="text-button-pay"> <a href={link} className="btn btn-orange text-white mt-2 w-100" style={{ backgroundColor: "#ff5722", borderColor: "#ff5722", padding: "10px", fontSize: "clamp(0.9rem, 1.5vw, 1.1rem)", // Fluid typography for button text borderRadius: "5px", textAlign: "center", display: "block", }} > View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right"></i> </a> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default EventSlide;
ChatGPT said:

Here’s your combined and refined EventSlide component, which integrates:

  • 🧡 Your EventCard design (image 3:2, orange badge/button)

  • ✅ Full-width image with rounded top corners

  • ✅ Card max width (400px), compact layout

  • ✅ Title, short description, and a clean “View More” button

  • ✅ Icons for date, time, and location can be optionally added if needed

✅ Combined EventSlide (Updated Version)

tsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

interface EventSlideProps {
  imgSrc: string;
  title: string;
  details: string[];
  link: string;
  date?: string;
  time?: string;
  location?: string;
  type?: string;
}

// Capitalize each word
const capitalizeWords = (str: string) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((w) => w.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + w.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventSlide: React.FC<EventSlideProps> = ({
  imgSrc,
  title,
  details,
  link,
  date,
  time = "12:00 PM",
  location,
  type,
}) => {
  const getFirstTenWords = () => {
    const allWords = details.join(" ").split(" ");
    return allWords.slice(0, 10).join(" ") + (allWords.length > 10 ? "..." : "");
  };

  return (
    <div
      className="w-full max-w-[400px] bg-white rounded-lg overflow-hidden shadow-md transition-transform"
    >
      <img
        src={imgSrc}
        alt={title}
        className="w-full object-cover"
        style={{ aspectRatio: "3 / 2" }}
      />
      <div className="p-4">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-2">
          <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800">
            {capitalizeWords(title)}
          </h4>
          {type && (
            <span className="bg-orange-500 text-white text-xs px-2 py-1 rounded">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <p className="text-sm text-gray-700 mb-2">{getFirstTenWords()}</p>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-600 space-y-1 mb-4">
          {date && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(date)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {time && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaClock className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{time}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {location && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(location)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
        </div>

        <a
          href={link}
          className="block w-full text-center text-white bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-600 transition-colors py-2 rounded"
        >
          View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right ml-1"></i>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventSlide;

Let me know if you’d like to:

  • Add fallback images

  • Make the card clickable

  • Add animation on hover

You said:
take the image and btn style from this code and add that to eventCard import React from 'react'; // Define the types for the props interface EventSlideProps { imgSrc: string; title: string; details: string[]; link: string; } const EventSlide: React.FC<EventSlideProps> = ({ imgSrc, title, details, link }) => { // Function to get the first 10 words from the details array const getFirstTenWords = () => { const allWords = details.join(" ").split(" "); return allWords.slice(0, 10).join(" ") + (allWords.length > 10 ? "..." : ""); }; return ( <div className="p-3 w-100" style={{ backgroundColor: "white", borderRadius: "15px", // Rounded corners overflow: "hidden", // Prevent content from overflowing boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)", // Soft shadow for professional look transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out", // Smooth hover effect }} > <img src={imgSrc} alt={title} className="img-fluid" style={{ width: "100%", height: "auto", objectFit: "cover", borderTopLeftRadius: "15px", borderTopRightRadius: "15px" }} /> <div className="down-content px-3 pt-3 pb-2"> <h4 className="h5 mb-2" style={{ fontSize: "clamp(1rem, 2vw, 1.5rem)" }}>{title}</h4> <p className="text-muted" style={{ fontSize: "clamp(0.8rem, 1.5vw, 1rem)", marginBottom: "0.5rem" }}> {getFirstTenWords()} </p> <div className="text-button-pay"> <a href={link} className="btn btn-orange text-white mt-2 w-100" style={{ backgroundColor: "#ff5722", borderColor: "#ff5722", padding: "10px", fontSize: "clamp(0.9rem, 1.5vw, 1.1rem)", // Fluid typography for button text borderRadius: "5px", textAlign: "center", display: "block", }} > View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right"></i> </a> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default EventSlide;
ChatGPT said:

Here’s your updated EventCard component with:

✅ Image and button styles copied exactly from the EventSlide
✅ Maintained layout from EventCard
✅ Clean, professional, responsive design
✅ Max width set to 400px
✅ Optional support for name, type, date, location, and id

✅ Final EventCard.tsx:

tsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

interface EventCardProps {
  name: string;
  type?: string;
  date?: string;
  time?: string;
  location?: string;
  image: string;
  id?: number | string;
  link?: string;
}

const capitalizeWords = (str: string) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((w) => w.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + w.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard: React.FC<EventCardProps> = ({
  name,
  type,
  date,
  time = "12:00 PM",
  location,
  image,
  link = "#",
}) => {
  return (
    <div
      className="w-full max-w-[400px] bg-white rounded-[15px] overflow-hidden shadow-md transition-transform"
      style={{ borderRadius: "15px", boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)" }}
    >
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        style={{
          width: "100%",
          height: "auto",
          objectFit: "cover",
          aspectRatio: "3 / 2",
          borderTopLeftRadius: "15px",
          borderTopRightRadius: "15px",
        }}
      />
      <div className="px-3 pt-3 pb-2">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-2">
          <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800">{capitalizeWords(name)}</h4>
          {type && (
            <span className="bg-orange-500 text-white text-xs px-2 py-1 rounded">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-600 space-y-1 mb-4">
          {date && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(date)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {time && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaClock className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{time}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {location && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(location)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
        </div>

        <a
          href={link}
          className="btn btn-orange text-white mt-2 w-100"
          style={{
            backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
            borderColor: "#ff5722",
            padding: "10px",
            fontSize: "clamp(0.9rem, 1.5vw, 1.1rem)",
            borderRadius: "5px",
            textAlign: "center",
            display: "block",
          }}
        >
          View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right ml-1"></i>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

Would you like a dark mode version or hover effects added next?

You said:
make it jsx
ChatGPT said:

Here's the JSX version of your improved EventCard component, with all TypeScript annotations removed and fully React-compatible:

✅ Final EventCard.jsx

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((w) => w.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + w.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, time = "12:00 PM", location, image, link = "#" }) => {
  return (
    <div
      className="w-full max-w-[400px] bg-white rounded-[15px] overflow-hidden shadow-md transition-transform"
      style={{ borderRadius: "15px", boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)" }}
    >
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        style={{
          width: "100%",
          height: "auto",
          objectFit: "cover",
          aspectRatio: "3 / 2",
          borderTopLeftRadius: "15px",
          borderTopRightRadius: "15px",
        }}
      />
      <div className="px-3 pt-3 pb-2">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-2">
          <h4 className="text-lg font-semibold text-gray-800">{capitalizeWords(name)}</h4>
          {type && (
            <span className="bg-orange-500 text-white text-xs px-2 py-1 rounded">
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <div className="text-sm text-gray-600 space-y-1 mb-4">
          {date && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaCalendarAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(date)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {time && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaClock className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{time}</span>
            </div>
          )}
          {location && (
            <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
              <FaMapMarkerAlt className="text-orange-500" />
              <span>{capitalizeWords(location)}</span>
            </div>
          )}
        </div>

        <a
          href={link}
          className="btn btn-orange text-white mt-2 w-100"
          style={{
            backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
            borderColor: "#ff5722",
            padding: "10px",
            fontSize: "clamp(0.9rem, 1.5vw, 1.1rem)",
            borderRadius: "5px",
            textAlign: "center",
            display: "block",
          }}
        >
          View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right ml-1"></i>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

Let me know if you want to add loading states, fallback images, or click handling for buttons instead of links.

You said:
use style for badge , css not working also make the spacing good between text and icon
ChatGPT said:

Here's your updated JSX version of the EventCard with the following improvements:

✅ Badge uses style instead of class (since your CSS might not be loading correctly)
✅ Proper spacing between icons and text
✅ Clean visual hierarchy and consistent spacing

✅ EventCard.jsx (Final Polished Version)

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((w) => w.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + w.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, time = "12:00 PM", location, image, link = "#" }) => {
  return (
    <div
      className="w-full"
      style={{
        maxWidth: "400px",
        backgroundColor: "white",
        borderRadius: "15px",
        overflow: "hidden",
        boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)",
        transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out",
      }}
    >
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        style={{
          width: "100%",
          objectFit: "cover",
          aspectRatio: "3 / 2",
          borderTopLeftRadius: "15px",
          borderTopRightRadius: "15px",
        }}
      />

      <div style={{ padding: "16px" }}>
        <div style={{ display: "flex", justifyContent: "space-between", marginBottom: "8px" }}>
          <h4 style={{ fontSize: "1.1rem", fontWeight: "600", color: "#333", margin: 0 }}>
            {capitalizeWords(name)}
          </h4>
          {type && (
            <span
              style={{
                backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
                color: "white",
                fontSize: "0.75rem",
                padding: "4px 8px",
                borderRadius: "4px",
                whiteSpace: "nowrap",
                alignSelf: "center",
              }}
            >
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <div style={{ fontSize: "0.95rem", color: "#555", marginBottom: "12px" }}>
          {date && (
            <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", marginBottom: "6px" }}>
              <FaCalendarAlt style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} />
              {capitalizeWords(date)}
            </div>
          )}
          {time && (
            <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", marginBottom: "6px" }}>
              <FaClock style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} />
              {time}
            </div>
          )}
          {location && (
            <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center" }}>
              <FaMapMarkerAlt style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} />
              {capitalizeWords(location)}
            </div>
          )}
        </div>

        <a
          href={link}
          style={{
            backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
            border: "none",
            color: "#fff",
            padding: "10px",
            fontSize: "1rem",
            borderRadius: "6px",
            textAlign: "center",
            display: "block",
            width: "100%",
            textDecoration: "none",
          }}
        >
          View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right" style={{ marginLeft: "6px" }}></i>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

This version works well without relying on Tailwind or external CSS, making it perfect for environments where custom classes aren’t loading.

Would you like a hover animation or loading placeholder for the image as well?

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, time, location, image, link }) => { return ( <div className="w-full" style={{ maxWidth: "400px", backgroundColor: "white", borderRadius: "15px", overflow: "hidden", boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)", transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out", }} > <img src={image} alt={name} style={{ width: "100%", objectFit: "cover", aspectRatio: "3 / 2", borderTopLeftRadius: "15px", borderTopRightRadius: "15px", }} /> <div style={{ padding: "16px" }}> <div style={{ display: "flex", justifyContent: "space-between", marginBottom: "8px" }}> <h4 style={{ fontSize: "1.1rem", fontWeight: "600", color: "#333", margin: 0 }}> {capitalizeWords(name)} </h4> {type && ( <span style={{ backgroundColor: "#ff5722", color: "white", fontSize: "0.75rem", padding: "4px 8px", borderRadius: "4px", whiteSpace: "nowrap", alignSelf: "center", }} > {capitalizeWords(type)} </span> )} </div> <div style={{ fontSize: "0.95rem", color: "#555", marginBottom: "12px" }}> {date && ( <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", marginBottom: "6px" }}> <FaCalendarAlt style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} /> {capitalizeWords(date)} </div> )} {time && ( <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", marginBottom: "6px" }}> <FaClock style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} /> {time} </div> )} {location && ( <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center" }}> <FaMapMarkerAlt style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} /> {capitalizeWords(location)} </div> )} </div> <a href={link} style={{ backgroundColor: "#ff5722", border: "none", color: "#fff", padding: "10px", fontSize: "1rem", borderRadius: "6px", textAlign: "center", display: "block", width: "100%", textDecoration: "none", }} > View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right" style={{ marginLeft: "6px" }}></i> </a> </div> </div> ); }; export default EventCard;
ChatGPT said:

Here’s a cleaned-up and de-duplicated version of your EventCard component with:

  • Reusable InfoRow subcomponent to remove repeated layout.

  • Better structure and clearer separation of logic and styles.

  • Fewer inline styles, only used where necessary.

✅ Optimized EventCard.jsx

jsx
import React from "react";
import { FaCalendarAlt, FaMapMarkerAlt, FaClock } from "react-icons/fa";

const capitalizeWords = (str) =>
  str
    ? str
        .toLowerCase()
        .split(" ")
        .map((w) => w.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + w.slice(1))
        .join(" ")
    : "";

const InfoRow = ({ icon: Icon, text }) => (
  <div style={{ display: "flex", alignItems: "center", marginBottom: "6px", color: "#555" }}>
    <Icon style={{ color: "#ff5722", marginRight: "8px" }} />
    <span>{capitalizeWords(text)}</span>
  </div>
);

const EventCard = ({ name, type, date, time, location, image, link }) => {
  return (
    <div
      style={{
        maxWidth: "400px",
        backgroundColor: "#fff",
        borderRadius: "15px",
        overflow: "hidden",
        boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)",
        transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out",
      }}
    >
      <img
        src={image}
        alt={name}
        style={{
          width: "100%",
          objectFit: "cover",
          aspectRatio: "3 / 2",
          borderTopLeftRadius: "15px",
          borderTopRightRadius: "15px",
        }}
      />

      <div style={{ padding: "16px" }}>
        <div style={{ display: "flex", justifyContent: "space-between", marginBottom: "12px" }}>
          <h4 style={{ fontSize: "1.1rem", fontWeight: "600", color: "#333", margin: 0 }}>
            {capitalizeWords(name)}
          </h4>
          {type && (
            <span
              style={{
                backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
                color: "#fff",
                fontSize: "0.75rem",
                padding: "4px 8px",
                borderRadius: "4px",
                whiteSpace: "nowrap",
                alignSelf: "center",
              }}
            >
              {capitalizeWords(type)}
            </span>
          )}
        </div>

        <div style={{ fontSize: "0.95rem", marginBottom: "16px" }}>
          {date && <InfoRow icon={FaCalendarAlt} text={date} />}
          {time && <InfoRow icon={FaClock} text={time} />}
          {location && <InfoRow icon={FaMapMarkerAlt} text={location} />}
        </div>

        <a
          href={link}
          style={{
            backgroundColor: "#ff5722",
            color: "#fff",
            padding: "10px",
            fontSize: "1rem",
            borderRadius: "6px",
            textAlign: "center",
            display: "block",
            width: "100%",
            textDecoration: "none",
          }}
        >
          View More <i className="fa fa-angle-double-right" style={{ marginLeft: "6px" }}></i>
        </a>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default EventCard;

Let me know if you'd like this turned into a reusable component with PropTypes or Tailwind support.

ChatGPT said:

To make the EventCard look better in your UpcomingEvents layout, here's how you can widen and enlarge it slightly while keeping responsiveness and visual balance in mind:

✅ Updates:

  • Slightly increased card width (maxWidth: 500px)

  • Adjusted font sizes for clarity

  • Better spacing/padding for larger screen comfort

  • Set column width using react-bootstrap Col

✅ Updated UpcomingEvents.jsx

jsx
import React from "react";
import { Container, Row, Col } from "react-bootstrap";
import EventCard from "../components/event_card";

const UpcomingEvents = () => {
  return (
    <section className="my-5">
      <Container>
        <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold mb-4 text-start">Upcoming Events</h1>
        <Row className="justify-content-start">
          <Col xs={12} md={6} lg={5}>
            <EventCard
              name="Jukti Reunion"
              type="Seminar"
              date="28/08/2024"
              time="12:00 AM"
              location="DMK-1009"
              image="https://zaidfahad.com/img/logo.jpg"
              link="/event/3"
            />
          </Col>
        </Row>
      </Container>
    </section>
  );
};

export default UpcomingEvents;

✅ Update in EventCard.jsx (optional fine-tuning)

Change maxWidth from 400px → 500px:

jsx
<div
  style={{
    maxWidth: "500px",
    backgroundColor: "#fff",
    borderRadius: "15px",
    overflow: "hidden",
    boxShadow: "0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)",
    transition: "transform 0.2s ease-in-out",
  }}
>

And if you want to scale up font sizes for readability:

jsx
<h4 style={{ fontSize: "1.25rem", fontWeight: "600", color: "#333", margin: 0 }}>

Let me know if you'd like to show multiple cards in a responsive grid or include a fallback for missing images.

ChatGPT can make mistakes. Check important info.
